Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:To locate a choker not located in a jewelry box or boutique where would you go? Choices:  A: jewelry store B: neck C: jewlery box D: jewelry box E: boutique<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Find a value in the solution that is not correct.<n><n>### Comments:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The only baggage the woman checked was a drawstring bag, where was she heading with it? Choices:  A: garbage can B: military C: jewelry store D: safe E: airport<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>***<n><n>Write two or more code lines using any of the following:<n>```<n>1. For Loop<n>2. While Loop<n>3. If-else<n>4. Looping Method<n>```<n>that appropriately complete the request.<n><n>***<n><n>1. For Loop:<n>```<n>for(int p = 0; p < quantity; p++)<n>    {<n>        if(p > quantity-1)<n>        {<n>            return 999;<n>        }<n>    }<n>    ```<n>2. While Loop:<n>```<n>while(quantity < 3)<n>   {<n>        price = quantity;<n>   }<n>```<n>3. If-Else:<n>```<n>if(a + b > 90)<n>{<n>    b = 999; //or a = 999<n>}<n>else<n>{<n>    a = 99;<n>}<n>```<n>4. Looping:<n>```<n>public class LoopingExample<n>{<n>    public static void main(String[] args)<n>    {<n>        int i = 0;<n>        while(++i < 10)<n>        {<n>             System.out.println("Loop : " + i);<n>        }<n>    System.out.println("\n Looping Finished\n");<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>```<n>public class CounterExample<n>{<n>    private int counter;<n><n>    public CounterExample()<n>    {<n>        counter = 0;<n>    }<n><n>    public void increment()<n>    {<n>       counter++;<n>    }<n><n>		public int count()<n>		{<n>			return counter;<n>		}<n>}<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where do you put your grapes just before checking out? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		<n>A -mouth<n><n>D -1 & 2 have fruit markets<n><n>E -2 & 3 have fruit market<n>

Corey has 5 more candies in a different jar. How many candies do they have altogether?|Output: 18 |<n>|Input: You can eat any number of cheeseburgers a night for 1 weeks straight or eat 4 cheeseburgers daily for 2 weeks straight. What will you eat for 4 weeks straight?|Output: 4 cheeseburger a day |<n>|Input: How many more times can you subtract 50 from 450 without having a nonzero result than can you subtract 5 from 325 without a nonzero result?|Output: 7|<n>|Input: There are 25 m&ms. You eat 1 m&m every minute. You ate 10 m&ms. Which value is closest to the amount of time it will take you to eat all 25 m&m's? |Output: 2 |

Choices:  A: write an essay B: organize thoughts C: speak information D: summarize main points E: have information<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A: Write an essay<n><n>#### Reason:<n><n>There are several ways to share ones thought but writing an essay would be one of the easiest way to share my thoughs.<n><n>You will have an impact on the thoughts of other people. You can write whatever you want. You can have your own opinion or write a story. You have a lot of freedom.<n><n>You can write long or short essays, whatever you feel like. You may be able to share your thoughts through pictures, but it's probably difficult and uncomfortable for others to read text in an essay. Including an image is good for others to understand what you are talking about.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What could happen to a paper if you leave it outside even if it does not move? Choices:  A: one material often recycled B: ripped C: saturated with water D: one dimensional E: crumpled<n><n>### Response:		C<n>### Explanation:When we leave it outside,it is saturated with water,this means that the paper will be destroyed.So,the correct choice is C.<n>

This includes things such as; the power of concentration, the physical strength needed, and the stamina for the game. It does not just involve physical demands, but also mental challenges and focus. One must have a lot of time commitment, discipline and patience in order to be an excellent player. In order to be successful in the game of tennis, one must be able to have the right attitude for the game, and the right kind of physical abilities that are needed if one is required to be successful in the sport of tennis. Without dedication to practice and mastering skills regularly, one will be defeated in the game of tennis no matter the level of the game. If one is not very disciplined, then they will most likely not be good at playing the game of tennis. Practice every day in order to get better at the game of tennis.

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The man uses grooming before a job interview, what is he trying to portray? Choices:  A: looking good B: beauty C: tardiness D: handsomeness E: neatness<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>><n>```<n><n>### Input-Answer:<n>```<n>>  <n>```<n><n>## Instruction<n><n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>**Input:** <n><n>  Tapanga and Core will share their candies with their siblings. <n><n>  Tapaanga has 8 more than Corey. <n><n>**Answer:** <n><n>29 candies<n><n>    Input: <n><n> The man uses grooming before  <n><n>  A: looking good <n><n>  B: beauty <n><n>  C: tardiness <n><n>  D: handsomeness <n><n>  E: neatness<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:To learn must have the right book, to work efficiently what must one have? Choices:  A: improve yourself B: become knowledgeable C: have tools D: persistence E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		Persistence<n><n>### Input<n>Write a response that appropriately makes a choice from one of the four multiple choice choices.<n><n>### Response<n>My first choice is to make a choice from one of four multiple choice choices from an instruction.<n>I will make a choice that will make the instruction run.<n>I always try to make the task run efficiently.<n>I try to make the answer run smoothly.<n>I try to show that I understand the instruction in a way that I can respond and make sense.<n>In order to make the task I chose make sense I will try to make the choices and responses as clear as possible.<n>### Input: If I go to school at 6am I need to wake up at 20 past 5, if I go to my work at 7 what's the earliest time that I should have to wake up?<n>### Respond: 6:39<n><n>### Input:"The bus departs at 4:20pm. I live 3 miles away. Walking there I get to the bus stop at 4:18pm. It takes 20 minutes longer to walk to the bus from the intersection. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Choices:  A: notoriety B: emotional distress C: riot D: bad dreams E: annoyance<n><n>### Response:		 Correct Answer: A<n><n>### Instructor:<n>-   If it doesn't make sense, ask the teacher. If what you were saying is not correct, apologize and then move on.<n><n>### Output:<n>-   Read all the answers and then pick the right one<n><n>#### Teacher Input<n>Input: This is an example of a _________ question.<n>Answer: multiple choice<n><n>Input: I wonder if you could help me with that.<n><n>### Feedback<n>- This assignment was not completed on time<n>- You scored %%total%% out of %%total%%<n>- You received %%total%%<n><n>#### Teacher Response<n><n>Thanks for your feedback. You got the first question right.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. Choices:  A: cause death B: cause bleeding C: falling down D: become infected E: claim insurance<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### My reasoning:<n><n>###### What is the worst outcome of the injury?<n><n>I think its claim insurance because if you get injured then that means you have to go to hospital and the cost of the treatment would be so much money and you would have to pay the entire cost of the treatment yourself and your insurance will cover your medical expenses<n><n>###### What would be the correct response?<n><n>The correct response is claim because its an option out of 5 to choose in the question and the options in the question are the worst outcome of an accident which means an accident which cause death, cause bleeding, falling down or become infected and since none of these are the outcome of an accident it can only be claim insurance<n><n>###### Reasoning with evidence<n><n>I think its a correct thing to say that the correct response should be claim because claim is the worst outcome of injury in which the cause of the injury is that the person has injured themselves by the accident so it should be claim but if claim wasn't correct then it should be claim because the question is based on the worst outcome of an error and claim is the worst outcome because the person is injured so it is correct to answer that it is claiming<n>

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The person was looking up airline and hotel prices, what was he looking to do? Choices:  A: control computer B: separate things C: go on vacation D: cross street E: go out<n><n>### Response:		D<n>

There will be one solution that follows the correct rules to complete the task.Write a response that appropriately follows the rules.<n><n>### Task: <n><n>Write a program that demonstrates the solution for the problem below.<n><n>You are stranded on an island in the middle of a vast ocean. Your only means of survival is the contents of a backpack that you have with you. The backpack has 70 gallons of water, 15 pounds of rice, one week's worth of medicine, one weeks worth of batteries, a parachute, and a compass. It also contains one of the following: flashlight, first aid kit, emergency blanket, hammock, tent, mosquito repellant, water filter, rope, fire-starter kit, sleeping bag.  You are only allowed to bring one item. What should you do?<n><n>### Rules:<n><n>1.	Rice, water and tents are of no help to a stranded survivor.<n>2.	The number of days is less than 7 and that day is a Saturday<n>3.	The parachute will never open<n>4.	A sleeping bag is only for sleeping, so the item selected should be used in its other applications.<n>5.	Bring the first aid kit so that if need arises, you can treat yourself, and since the medicine would also be useful, a first aid kit seems like the best way to go.<n>6.	It is not safe to leave the parachute behind.<n>7.	The items in the backpack are not numbered<n>8.	You must bring with you items that are mentioned in the backpack in the rules<n><n>In the above rules, you can select any of them.<n><n>### Solution:<n>In the list of items in the backpack, the rope and the parachute are excluded to be of no use. Only the tent is left, with 70 gallons and 15 pounds of water, 250 gallons and 30 pounds of rice, 4

Choices:  A: kitchen B: child's hand C: street D: toy store E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		If your child drops the ball that you gave to them, it is probably a good time to buy another ball. You can buy one at a soccer store or at a child's hand.<n><n>### Input : A child sells peanut butter, jelly, and banana sandwiches for 2, 3 and 8 cents respectively. What is the largest amount a single person can spend?<n><n>### Response :A child can spend a maximum of 28 cents. This is because they will only spend the minimum amount on each sandwich.<n><n>###Input: The largest container has 50 ounces. One and one-fourth pints are 15 ounces and one cup is 8 ounces. If the smallest container's volume is equal to one-fifth the largest container's volume, how much smaller is the largest container than the smallest container?<n><n>###Response: The containers' volumes are related using the following equation. Volume(V) = 1.4 * 15 + 11 = 40. Volume(L) = 50 - 40 = 10. Therefore, the largest container is 10 ounces larger than the smallest container.<n><n>###Instruction: Write a sentence that completes the thought.<n><n>"_____"<n><n>###Demonstration :"My name is _____ I am a _____."<n><n>Response: "My name is Tate and I am a chef."<n><n>###Instructions: Write a sentence that correctly states the information that follows.<n>"I only eat fruit."<n><n>###Demostration: "I only eat fruit." <n><n>Response: "I do not eat fruit."<n><n>

Another 2-digit number (in base 4) is called out. The result of each call out is used to create another 2-digit number. Then the whole sequence is repeated. For example, if you were to follow these instructions, you might hear the following: *9637 *9 = 9370<n>*842<n><n>*932<n>*62<n><n>If the first call out is the number (***235***), then what is the last call out?<n><n>Input/Response:<n>A 5- digit number (in the form *8976*) is called out. Then another 2- digit number (in base 11) is called out. This is repeated a total of three times before the sequence is repeated. For Example, if you were to Follow these instructions, you might listen to the following sequence: *4817 *8475 *6125 *3675 *7847<n>*8475<n><n>*832<n><n>*834<n><n>*9947 *8873 *7725 *7837<n><n>What is the 4-digit number?<n><n>Input/Respose:<n><n>Input:What animal has one of the smallest brains of any animal on earth?<n><n>Response:<n>It has one of the smallest brain of all animals in the world.<n><n>Input:In a math problem, which of the following can't be negative: the quantity, the variable, or both?<n><n>Response:Variable<n><n>Input:In what year was the first-ever Thanksgiving celebration in England?<n><n>Response:1623<n><n>Input:In how many feet can a caterpillar crawl in one day?<n><n>Response:20<n><n>Input:In math, is an exponent always a whole number?<n><n>Response:No<n><n>Input:In mathematics, how many integers are there less than 385?<n><n>Response:7<n><n>Input:In order to figure out how many people will be

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How many students got a 25/25?<n><n>### Response :D<n><n>### Input  :  Which of the following could be a reasonable number for your age?<n>  Choices : A: 30 B: 33 C: 1 D: 21 E: None of the above<n><n>### Response   :C<n><n>### Input     :A man is waiting in a restuarant and has not yet ordered his meal. He walks outside to a nearby table and takes over a seat from a man. They both immediately leave. When the man gets up and walks out of the restuarant, who has the longer seat? <n>  Choices        :A: the long seat in the resturant B: the man who took over the long seat in the restaurant C: both have the short seat in the restuarant D: the man who was standing is sitting in the long seat in the rastuarant E: the first mam got the short seat in the restaurant<n><n>### Response    :D<n><n>##### Input       :There are 4 men in a house. If 1 is on the first floor and 2 are on the third floor, which floor has the most men?<n>Choices            :A: the first floor B: the second floor C: the fourth fodu D: the third floor E. the first three floors<n><n>### Response     :(B)<n><n>### Input       :2 men have to mow 2 lawns, which weigh 10 pounds and 4 ounces. The second man mows one of the lawns, and one of the lawn gets mowed by the 1st man. <n>B. Both men mow the two lawns equally.<n>C. The mower breaks and the men use a knife to cut the one lawn.<n>D. Both men mow both lawns.<n><n>### Response      :D<n>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. The steps were:<n>1: Started at the beginning and determined the first and second largest number.<n>2: Then we determine the largest number based on the previous two numbers.<n>3: Then we determine the smallest number among the three number.<n>4: Then take the fourth to figure out what the fourth number is by subtracting the first largest number from the second largest number.<n><n>It took me about 15-20 minutes to get this done.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What is another term for instituting civil action? Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would need to look at the options before I came to an answer. The question says instituting civil action, so I would choose E which is protests. <n><n>### Input:(1 point) What is another term for instuiting civil action? Choises:( A): confusion (B): complications (C): riot (D): arrest (E): protests <n><n>### Response:(1 point) E

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you have no containers, the rose will be happy in a garden. All roses want the same things: sunlight, room to grow, and warmth. They need very little water, so do not put a rosebush in the garden during the dry months of summer. Your rosebush will do best if you put it in the ground where it will have plenty of room to grow, and where it will get six to eight hours of sun every day.<n>Your rosebush will also need some fertilizer twice a year in the spring and in early fall.<n>### Response:B<n><n>### Input:(Choose the best answer.) How old will Ricky be in 21 days? A:31 B:32 C:34<n><n>### Response:(Choose the best response.) When Ricky is 37 he will be 31 years older than he was when he was 21. Add up 21, 31, 32, 34, to find the answer.<n><n>### Input:$15 + $20 * 24 =<n><n>### Response:$15 + $480<n><n>### Input:# + 33 =<n>### Response: 43<n>### Input: I have exactly enough money to buy 3 apples for $3.50 or 15 donuts for $25. If I buy the donuts, how many apples can I buy?<n><n>### Response(Choose the best response.): $25 - $3.50 = $21.50. $21.5 + 15 = $36.50. I can buy 16 apples for $36.5.<n><n>### INVALID INPUT:This is the instruction:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Response: Answer is not 100% correct.<n><n>### Response :How many apples can I get for $5?<n><n>### Input : How many more dogs does Cameron have than Boris? Cameron - Boris =<n>### Response :Boris has 24 dogs and Cameron has 42 dogs. Boris doesn't have more than Cameron. If Boris has 20 fewer dogs than Cameron then the answer would be 20.<n>

Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		<n>There is a huge variety of definitions offered on the Internet to describe protests or a protest event. Here are several of the most common definitions: <n><n>* A protest is an act of verbal or civil disobedience undertaken by a person or group to promote or advocate a political, economic, and social ideology.<n>* A protest is a form of nonviolent activism that often seeks to attract the public attention of authorities in order to generate political, economic, or social change.<n>* A protest or demonstration is a statement of opposition to an idea, an action, or present circumstances which is made by a large group of people. Most often, a demonstration is a form of protest in which people publicly express their opinions.<n><n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident.  Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where are a lot of offices in New York? Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- A<n><n>### Input:(Answers)(Choices)<n><n>### Response :(Answers)<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>You are given a binary number. Your task is to produce a number with the same value in the least number of binary operations as possible. Your answer must be in a string format.<n><n>### Input<n><n>1111110<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>- 2<n><n>## Solution<n>```Python<n>a = 11111<n>a = "1" + "1" + "0" + "0"<n>a = [int(x) for x in a]<n>a = int(a)<n>b = 0<n>while a!= 0:<n>    a = a/10<n>    b += 1<n>#print b<n>```<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Suppose you have a list of binary numbers. Your task is to check whether there exists a binary number in the list that has a binary representation that is equal to the sum of the representations of each of its digits. For example, the sum of a binary number’s digits is 6 in a binary representation 110. An example input list is ["11","111","011011"]. Your task is to detect that a particular binary number exists in the list, and print such a binary number as your answer.<n><n>### Solution<n>```python<n>ans = 0<n>digits = []<n>for x in nums:<n>    newString = str(x)<n>    if int(newString)!= int(newString[::-1]):<n>        digits = digits + [int(newString)]<n><n>for x in digits:<n>    if all(x==x[1:]):<n>        anns = str(ans) + str(newString)<n>        print(anss)<n>        ans += 1<n>```<n><n>### Test Case 1:<n>```Python<n>[11, 111, 0110101]<n><n>1 [2, 1, 0]<n>```<n><n>## Test Cases:<n>- [1, 1, 1,2] - [1, 110,10001]<n>- [11, 00, 0

Choices:  A: cabinet B: library C: nightstand D: stationery store E: desk drawer<n><n>### Response:		James looked for the pencil sharpener in a cabinet.<n><n>### Input How to make 9000 dollars?<n><n>### Response 1: <n><n><n>```<n>(1000*100) + (2000*20) - 10<n>```<n><n>### Response Two<n><n>```<n>(2*150) * (2*1/4) + (30+40)<n>```<n><n>## Examples <n><n>```<n>Tapanga and Corey each have 29 candies. But Tapanga has a total of 8 more candies that Corey does. How many candies, in total, do Tapanga and Core have? <n><n>Answer: Tapanga has 37 candies and Corey has 29 candies<n>```<n><n>```<n>1) How many days, in total, is 70% of the time spent at that place?<n><n>Answer: Days spent at location was 70%.<n>70% will be half of 70=35.<n>Days spent at location is 35 <n>```<n><n><n>``` <n><n>2) How many days, that is 30% less than the days spent at that place, will have twice the sum of the days spent at that location?<n>Answer: <n>Days spent at each location, T = 20 <n>D = (30-T)<n>T = 2/(30-D)<n><n>```<n><n>``` <n>3) A school bus, that can hold 65 students, must make 2 trips between school and the ice rink, where 56 and 8 students stay on at each location, respectively. How many students can the bus carry on any single trip?<n>Answer:<n>65 <n>```<n>

How many students are at the shoe shop at one time?<n>Answer is 5<n><n>Input : There are three boxes that will be filled with 12 balls. Choices:  A: inspiration B: much work C: boredom D: graduate E: degree<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**C**, boredom<n><n>### Explanation: <n><n>This is a single-choice question where the number of choices is more than two.<n><n>The question asks about attending school for twelve whole years, so the correct answer is option C: boredom.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Two dogs have been fighting for 6 hours. If every hour the conflict escalated by 2 minutes at first and then after each hour it remained at the same level, how long will the fight last?<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>One hour<n><n>### Explantion<n><n>This question contains the phrase "each subsequent hour," which means that if each hour the fight escalates by 2 minutes, the fight doesn't escalate more than the time that has elapsed since the last fight. After 59 minutes have elapsed, the difference in time is 1, and the fight will last "one more hour."<n><n>### Input <n><n>Three fighters have been wrestling in a ring for 15 hours and 25 minutes. If the fights have only taken place if at least two fighters were in the ring at the same time, how many fighters have wrestled at least 30 minutes?<n><n><n>## Explanation<n><n>The answer for how many fighters wrestled for at least 30 mins. is three. Two of fighters started the fight, and then a third fighter joined and it took 10 more seconds for there to be 30 mins of fighting.<n><n><n>## Instructions <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>## Output<n><n>### Output:<n><n><n>## Input:<n><n>Input: The price at some convenience stores are displayed with a decimal point. Suppose a certain candy bar costs \$3.95 and another costs \$4.95. If a customer buys four candy bars, what is the total purchase amount in dollars? <n><n>### Exemplar/response<n><n>Total purchase amount = 4 x ($3.95 + $4.95) = $265<n><n>## Instruções<n><n>#### Instruções <n><n>### Sobre: <n><n>O usuário deve escrever um código para determinar o

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A, D, E<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Input<n>A: 10<n>A: -10<n>A: 12<n>B: 10<n>B: 98<n>B: 2<n>B: 29<n>C: 20<n>C: 30<n>C: -2<n>D: 3<n>D: 4<n>D: -8<n>E: (-2)<n>E: (-4)<n>E: (1)<n><n>### Output:<n>```<n>A -> -2<n>B -> -114<n>C -> 10<n>D -> -4<n>E -> 2<n>```<n><n>### Output Explanation<n>10 minus 10 is -10<n>-10 minus 12 is -12<n>-10 minus -4 equals 16<n>10 plus -2 is -8<n>-2 plus 98 is -96<n>20 minus (-2) is 12<n>30 minus (-4) is 60<n>2 minus (-2) equals 0<n>2 minus -4 equals 0<n>...etc<n><n>### Input Example 1:<n>```<n>Input: Choices:  A,  D<n>```<n>We begin by trying to combine choices A and D. When we do combine these two choices, we get answer B. So Choices B minus A equals answer D. So we must first subtract A from B - which gives us -114. Next we add 10 to -114 - which gives us -2. Next we add 29 to -2 - which gives us 27. Next we subract 10 from 27- which gives us -17. Next we subtract -17 from the choices available (minus 10 and minus -10) - giving us 7<n><n>### Input Explanation 1:<n>```python<n>def calculate(x):<n>    if isinstance(x, list):<n>        try:<n>            return [num_choices.subtract(num_calculated) for num_choices, num_calculated in zip([input], x)]<n>        except TypeError:<n>            return 0<n>    elif isinstance(x, int):<n>        return input.subtract(x)<n>

How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What area is likely to contain a large village? Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		It likely has to be some sort of suburb I think as the village would be closer to city life and rural areas wouldn't have that many people in. As B doesn't provide as many opportunities for living. I could be wrong but that's just my opinion lol<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>I thought that this was worded a bit weird and was confused by it. It just seemed like there was way too many options on there and made it hard for me to choose one that was correct. I had no idea what to put down there.<n><n>#### Struggle:<n>The sentence just really confused me. It got the meaning across but what he said with those choices just didn't click with what I know to be there. I've only been able to put B as my answer because it mentions city life and big houses, which are likely to be found in big suburbs. The word choices just felt so disconnected to what I though each one meant.<n><n>#### Ideas for Future Solutions:<n>I think a better response to that question would have been a longer one and I think that it will have the answer in the same way. It won't be something that is confusing and won't provide me with a problem just because there is too many choices/I can't narrow down what the question wants me to put as the answer.<n><n><n>

He sold 15 on Monday, 3 on Tuesday, and 5 less on Wednesday. How many books were remaining?"<n><n>### Response:"610"<n><n>### Answer:<n>```text<n>"There is a book in the cupboard." - Expectation is to remove the book, but not to put a book in.<n>"Expectation is not mentioned in the book." - The book does mention it.<n>```<n><n>### Input:(Ali had a stock<n><n>### Response:(remaining <n><n>### Input:-The book<n><n>### Input(Ali<n><n>### Input":"Ali<n><n>## The Inputs for a response include both the instruction and the request. There are always inputs for the request that describe a task and inputs for the response that describe a reply.<n><n>## A task consists of data given as instruction, and a result, the calculation or other action, that will be done with that data.<n><n>A request is simply the initial statement of a question.<n><n>A reply is the reply to the question which is the request.<n><n>A response provides a new task to complete based on the inputs. The response is a request.<n><n>## The example below is an instruction asking for a particular mathematical result. Write a response that provides the requested calculation.<n><n>### Input:[Ali had a stock]<n><n>### Input (Alias had a stock)<n><n>### Input"The book"<n><n>### Input of 400 stock books"<n><n>### Response to write out the request (Ali had a stock)<n>### Response:- 600 books in his stock.<n>### Reply<n>### "Ali had a stock"<n>### Response to provide the  result that Ali had<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Request<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### How do you do it?<n><n>### Show example<n><n>### Ask for a new task or question after you are done providing the calculation.<n><n>## There is only enough room to show an example here, but you can easily see that a request and a request have 50 characters each, and

Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n><n>### Response:		I agree with your choice<n><n>### Input:"Juice is my favorite beverage; I like all the flavors except strawberry." Which of the following is true according to the statement given above?<n><n>- Choice 1 (Juice is my only favorite beverage. I like all the flavor except strawberry) - NOT correct<n>- Choice 2 (Strawberry is not my favorite beverage. I only like Orange) - NOT correct<n><n>The correct and only correct options is Choice 3<n>- (I like all the flavors. Juice is my favorite beverages except for strawberry) - CORRECT<n><n>### Input "All the cars from the 80s were made from metal." Choices:  A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. None of my beeswax<n><n>### Response "I don't follow" - NOT CORRECT<n><n>Option D is a commonly used phrase that indicates that I am not concerned or interested in what you are saying.<n><n>Option C means I don't think it is useful or worth my time to consider the information, though I don't hate it.<n><n>### Input"The new Harry Potter film will release in June in Chicago." Choices:A. Yes B. No  C. Maybe<n><n>### Response:"I heard Harry Potter is going to be released soon" - NOT CORRET<n><n>An open-ended question needs to be answered with an open-ended response.<n><n>### Example:<n>Open-ended question:<n>Which of these words do you like more?<n><n>Open-ended question response<n>>I like green because it is relaxing and refreshing<n><n>##### How do I answer a closed question?<n><n>Closed questions need to be answered with a yes or no or a single word.  If asked a closed question, you need to use a word/phrase<n>of less than 4 words.<n><n>### How to answer:<n>A) Closed question  : How many people were in the bar?<n><n>Closed Question Answer:<n><n>It was a bit busy, 50 people at capacity.<n><n>B) Open-ended question: What did you like more about the event?<n><n>Open-Ended Question response:<n><n>>I liked the music and art displays.

What is our cake-baking friend going to say when her mother arrives and sees that the cake isn't out of the oven and ready to decorate? Choices: A: "sorry it took so long, I didn't get a cake ready in time." B: "this time I got all my ingredients ready, and I still couldn't finish it in time." C: "sorry ma, my cake isn't ready yet." D: "I didn't get your cake finished in time." ____Earlier, I mentioned the cake-baking metaphor. Let's take a closer look at that metaphor. The cake-baking process:<n><n>1. You choose a recipe.<n><n>2. You gather your ingredients.<n><n>3. You mix everything together.<n><n>4. You wait while the cake is baking.<n><n>5. You take the cake out of the oven.<n><n>6. You decorate the cake.<n><n>The word that goes with one of the above steps is "baking." In our sentence, it's the word that goes with "cake." (If you were looking for a word rather than a step.)<n><n>Let me provide a bonus metaphor that will make the last sentence make more sense. You may or may not know this, but cake-baking is actually a metaphor for getting ready for college. Choices: A: gathering ingredients, mixing everything together<n><n>### Answer<n><n>B. 1500 BCE<n><n>### How to interpret the question:Write a response that completes the request.

Find and spell words that go from that list to a list of 65 words that includes these vowels.<n><n>* TANUMPIT <n>* KOMNIZDONNIL<n>* OBLIPIDANI<n>* IMOKNAIOPERN<n>* HONTONA<n>* MOPINIAUS<n>* NONOLIF<n>* TAROMANU<n>* ADIAMA<n><n>### In the table below, there are 111 entries. A number is listed for each entry, but there are no 10s or 61s in the table. What is the average difference between one consecutive number and the adjacent number?<n><n># ENTRY #     # SURPRISE?<n>1    7<n>2    9   no<n>3  10   yes<n>4  12   yes<n>5  16   yes<n>6  24   yes<n>7  28   no<n>8  42   yes<n>9  11   no<n>10   0   no<n>11  20   yes<n>12  22   no<n>13  48   yes<n>.<n>.<n>.<n>110  47   yes<n>111  49   no<n><n>### In some countries, the letters i and j are sometimes used interchangeably. If you think of the letter i as the number 1 and j as the number 10, which of these two-digit numbers are always divisible by 10, which are always even, and which are divisible by 3?<n><n>i     j<n>1     10<n>2     20<n>3     30<n>4     40<n>5     50<n>14    49<n>15    54<n>16    
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where is a road known as a motorway? Choices:  A: scotland B: europe C: race track D: new jersey E: england<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is A: scotland.

If it is a question with the correct answer that is not included in the answer choices, it will not change the result of the overall grade.<n>B. If it is a task in which a student is required to change a value and then ask a mathematical question about the change made, and the correct answer is not included in the choices, the student will receive a "Correct" answer, but the question will not count towards the grades overall.<n><n>If a choice is not included, but is correct, the grade will be correct but not complete. Please include appropriate answers whenever possible.<n><n>## Question:<n>Sometimes the wording in a question may result in an incorrect answer choice. When this does occur, the grader is instructed to choose <n><n>```<n>A. an incorrect answer choice<n>B. the correct answer choice<n>C. a choice that makes no sense<n>D. a choice that has a problem in the question itself<n>```<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Corrections:<n>The instructions for the grader of an answer are:<n>A. Use the correct answer. B. Use the first correct answer in your opinion and mark the correct answer as you are marking incorrect answers. C. If you don't know the answer, use the first answer you can and mark it as an incorrect answer. D. If you don's know the answer, mark it as an incorrect and skip it.<n><n>### Grading<n><n><n>## Instruction:(if used on a 0 to 1 assignment or section)<n>The grader should enter the total and the weight of the assignment or section in the box below. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:You'd add pepper and salt to what liquid meal if it's bland? Choices:  A: supermarket B: water C: cellars D: soup E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Inputs:Rachel is taking a survey on a school bus. On the survey, the answer choices are A,B,C,D. How would Rachel use her survey data to answer the question: What fraction of children ages 10 and younger chose A?<n><n>### Response 1:<n>  B/6 (40% of 1022)<n><n>### Response2:<n>  C/8 (66% of 1248)<n><n>### Other Inputs:<n>* A/27 B/59<n>* A/68 B/19<n>* A/2698 B/3611<n>* 1/11 B/934<n>* 6/18 B/992<n>* 27 A/1009<n>* 47 A/1585<n>* A/7683<n>* B/7948<n>* C/9050<n>* D/17897<n><n>* 6% of 1000 is 60<n><n>* 64% of 120 is 76<n><n>### More Inputs:<n>* 4/10 = 50%<n>* 5/7= 71%<n>* 3/4 = 75%<n>* 12/30 = 40%<n>* 166/394 = 42.7%<n>* 283/506 = 55.9%<n>* 600/800 = 75%

At my undergraduate university and during my master's program<n><n>	- No<n><n>	- I can think of classes where I felt less intelligent than my classmates, but we all graduated successfully<n><n>	- I have been in the classes with students that had a GPA worse than me, but this never prevented us from gettin A's<n><n>- Have you been in a class with students where there was a GPA spread among the class?<n><n>	- YES<n><n>	- No, but I was in some with SAT cut-offs<n><n>	- In some grad class but it was not as rigorous as a freshman college class<n><n>	- No.<n><n><n>
