Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The friends loved competing against one another, it was a good way to work their what? Choices:  A: friendship B: aggression C: defeat D: winning or losing E: sweat<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input The two boys were not as tall as their dads, but they were taller than their moms. How many inches, in height, were the moms shorter than the dads?<n>    <n>### Response: 140<n>    <n>### Input:A dog is sleeping at 5 am and it sleeps for 3 hours.  What time, according to the given times, does the dog wake up?<n>### Response: The dog will wake up at 8 o' clock.<n><n>### Input What is the value of the 25th letter in the English alphabet?<n><n>### Response : The value of that number is 2<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Demoscene: There are two words that need to be reordered. Input these words to perform the rearrangement. You must then insert the words into the paragraphs below to form the original sentence again. You must not change the order of any characters (spaces, letters, numbers or punctuation). The solution must display as a string.<n><n>#### Solution<n><n>The 4 friends were:<n><n>* Shannon<n>* Truman<n>* Michael<n>* Corey<n><n>## The output<n>The original sentence is “The 4 friends were.”<n><n>Input: Shannon,Truman,Michael,Corey<n><n>## Output:<n><n>The 4 Friends Were<n><n>## Your Task<n><n>1. There is an empty paragraph and 2 sets of words.<n>2. Read the instructions and try to write the instructions.<n><n>## Instrucion:<n><n>Your task is to create your own questions. Use only these rules:<n><n>1. Each question should consist of the following elements:<n>- Header<n>- Instructions with multiple choice answers<n>- Demomscne with 3 words<n>- 2 blank spaces<n>2. Use only one header line at the start or it will be deleted, make a comment line if you want to.<n>3. Each question must have an input and a response.<n>4. Your question should be on the format in the sample.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What type of water transportation is human powered? Choices:  A: turn away B: let down C: have to sleep D: run E: row boat<n><n>### Response:		Human powered<n><n>### Input. Which is bigger: 22 inches 5cm, C: 2.2 cm<n><n>### Response. C is bigger<n><n>### Inputs: A) 779 days, B) 223 days<n><n>### Response A) 3 years, 2 months<n><n>### Instructions:Choose the best answer for the question.<n><n>## 1. Diana went on a trip. She flew 800 miles to the airport of her flight. Then she boarded the plane and flew for 1,300 miles.  She then went to the airport of the city she lived in 500 miles away.   How many miles did Diana travel, all in all?<n><n>Answer : 2300<n><n>## 2. When Siena walks, her feet 12 steps for every 100 meters of her walk.  One day she walked 450 meters. How many steps did she walk?<n><n>Answer :  48<n><n>## 3. In the morning, Alia woke up 190 minutes earlier than she does in the afternoon. However, she slept 130 minutes longer.How much later does she wake up in the morning?<n><n>Answer : -60<n><n>## 4. On Monday and Tuesday, the price of a bicycle was $7 less than the price of a bike.  If a bicycle price was $42 on Tuesday, how much did it cost on Monday?<n><n>Answer : $49<n><n>## 5. On Tuesday, the average temperature in the city was 58 degrees. Yolanda earned $40 from cutting weeds in the garden. Together, Mariana and Yolanda earned a total of $120 during their work together. How much money did Yolanda earn?<n><n>Answer :9<n><n>## 7. Tuesday in the gym, Iris exercised for 120 minutes longer than she worked out for on

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n>### A: hunt<n>### B: pay merchandise with money<n>### C: mail order<n>### D: spend money<n>### E: demand complete satisfaction<n><n>### Input (continued):The store offers three ways for shoppers to pay for merchandise:  A: with credit cards B: with store credit C: with cash<n><n>### Response(continued):<n>### A: with credit cards<n>### B: with store credit<n>### C: with cash <n><n>Input: It costs $13 for an 8 hour massage in Mexico.  In the US, the same massage costs $100.  If you receive a massage two hours per day, for 5 days and get paid $20 an hour, how much money would you make from having the massage while abroad?<n>Answer: 400<n><n>Input (continued): A massage in Mexico costs a fraction of what it does for the equivalent time spent in the US.<n>Input: You are having a party and have made a list of possible guests.  You have planned for a guest count of 50, but no more than 40.  Out of your list of possible guests, how many would actually fit?<n>Answer: 0<n><n>Input (Continued): If you include more than 40 guests, some people will have to get left out.<n>Input: You have 500 cinnamon hearts, 200 baking bites and 150 chocolate chips in your pantry. You decided to make 200 cookie sandwiches, which includes baking one baking bites along with 5 chocolate chips. How many cookies sandwiches can be made?<n>Answer: 77<n><n>Input (Continuued): The cookie sandwich is a cookie that comprises a baking bite and 5 chocolate bits.<n>Input: You need to cut a square from a large paper. It takes a certain number of squares to cut a quarter of the sheet, how many squares do you need to cut to have exactly three quarters left?<n>Answer: 8 <n><n>Input (Cont'd): You can always cut just over a square, so you need to cut just 7. <n>Input: Your

Find the number of apples he has now.<n><n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Joe's initial number of apples were: 11.<n>He now has 8 apples left.<n>Hence, he now has 3 apples.<n><n>### Input #:<n>Demonstrate an example of how to make 25% of 805 using multiplication<n><n>Answer: 2007<n><n>### Exlanation:<n>25% is the fraction: 25/100<n><n>805 is the number: 805<n><n>Multiplication:<n><n>805 x [25/102]<n><n>= 2007(ans)<n><n>### Input<n><n>Demonstrate a situation in which rounding makes a difference<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>Answer: 12 and 13<n><n>It was $12 dollars, but when rounded to the nearest dollar amount it becomes $13 dollars.<n><n>### <n><!--- DO NOT EDIT THIS LINE --><n><script type="text/javascript" src="{{ site.baseurl  }}assets/js/instructions/exercise_01.11.pdf.js"></script><n><!--- DO CHANGE THIS ONCE AN ANSWER IS CHOSEN --><n><![endif]--><n><iframe id="exercise_03"<n>src="https://www.mathplayground.com/instructor/questions/exercise_2011_exercise_02/html/exercise_answer"<n>width="100%" height="600px " frameborder="0" scrolling="auto"></iframe><n><n>

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:John spent too much money buying products for his swollen testicles.  He did so because he was feeling what? How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Choices:  A: two feet B: two ears C: horns D: lay eggs E: one head<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I found this question to be rather difficult. I had to make three guesses on the question. It seems to me this was intended for 4th graders or high school students based off the questions and answer choices. However, since I made three guesses I am going to put a little time and effort into the solution. First I am going to think what does the answer choice mean.<n><n>A: "two feet"<n><n>If the question asks what is it like having to run when you have two feet then I think it's referring to humans. When a human runs the heel of the foot hits the ground first then the tip of the toes.<n><n>B: "two ears"<n><n>A human has two ears not one ear on its head. If you're talking about the part that connects to the brain then I think it is referring to dogs. If that is the case then I am incorrect on this.<n><n>C: "horns"<n><n>I am not sure why it is saying this. Certain species such as cattle have horns growing from its head. I still am not sure what the answer to this question is.<n><n>D: "lay eggs"<n><n>Well, I believe that this answer is correct because a human does indeed lay eggs. Although, these eggs are called ova. Humans produce sex cells inside ova. Then they have two sex partners and the female will get pregnant.<n><n>E: "one head"<n><n>In this answer choices the question is asking about a head which is a human head and not a skull. It is also referring to that most humans have one skull on their body.<n><n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>After my three incorrect guesses I had to think hard about the question. The best way I knew to solve this was to make a flow chart or if there was a program that could help with this then I would use that.<n><n>#### Flow chart:<n><n>Input: What do all humans have on their heads?<n>Answer:<n><n>- Choice 1 : Horns<n><n>- Choice2 : Lay Eggs<n><n>- Choices : Two Feet<n><n>- Choices2 : One Head<n><n>- Chceice3 : Two Ears<n><n>Answer: Yes<n><n>

Choices:  A: university B: concert C: home D: terminal E: airport<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>In each task, ask a question and write the most appropriate answer.<n>>Note: for choice 'A' it was the university that it was highly criticized for the security since a teenager accidentally killed himself, with his own gun<n><n>### Instructing:<n>You can play the part of a teacher. Ask questions such as, "Why?" or "How does it work?"<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>You could do it on the computer like on this image:<n>![](images/Screenshot-20180201164041693.png)<n>### Instructs:<n>Write the most appropriate answer to the questions your students will ask (in your own words),<n><n>### Instuititious:<n>In this sample task we have 2 student's responses. Select one of the most appropriate response.<n><n>1. The student has made a few errors on the following sentence.<n>- Can you correct the sentence?<n><n>2. The student's response to the question below does not look quite right.<n>- Can you help?<n><n>### Instituent:<n><n>- A: 40 minutes <n>- B: 1 1/2 hours<n>- C: 90 minutes<n>- D: 75 minutes<n>- E: 50 minutes<n><n>### Instutution:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n><n>### Instuctional:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the following multiple choice question:<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Then output y which should equal 7.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Output<n><n>### Comments:<n>Add 4 to x<n>y = 4<n><n><n>### Code<n><n>```javascript<n>let x = 3;<n>x += 4;<n>console.log(x);<n><n>let y = 4;<n>```<n>

How many more slides than necessary do you need?<n><n>### Instructions<n>Daniel did not receive any cakes so the cakes did not weight him down.<n><n>### Daniel’s final weight = Total of cakes (60) + Daniel’s weight (10) = 70<n><n><n>### Daniel received 30 cakes with 1 kg in each cake, which gives a total weight of<n>30 * 1 kg = 30 kg for each cake. Daniel is 160 kg. Daniel’s final weight is:<n>### 30 * 1 = 30 kg + 160 kg = 190 kg<n><n><n>### Input Daniel is going down a set of stairs 10 cakes tall. Daniel is 10 kg less at the top then

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would you put silverware once they've dried, but you're not ready to use them. Choices:  A: table B: restaurant C: cupboard D: kitchen E: sink<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: If you are not ready to use the silverware, but they are still wet from washing then there are plenty of options and places to put them. The most logical options are to put them in the cabinet or to dry them in the sink, or a place that you can dry the silverware, making a lot that you would normally put away. <n>The answer could be either, but I am unsure if putting them in a cabinet would be logical, because it would normally require some sort of drying.<n><n>### Input:#of what time is it?<n><n>### Response:#It is [XX:XX]<n><n>### #Input:# How many are in the school if [number] is added to 76? <n><n>### #Response: #The answer is 83<n><n>### #Instruction: 8 children in a school have given up on eating candy bars because they don't like the flavor. Kaii ate ⅔ of the grapes and Tapanga ate  ⅖ of the grapes. How many grapes are left?<n><n>### Solution: Tapanga ate a third of the grapes, and Kaii ate two thirds of the grapes left over, leaving 16 grapes. <n>##Instruction:How many are in the school after you add 51 to 88.<n><n>###Solution:Adding 51 to 58 is the same as taking away 15, because 15+58 = 73 and 51 + 58 = 110<n><n>Answer: There are 110 students in the school after you added 51 to 78.<n>##Instruction:What is half of half?<n><n>###Solutioin:Half of half is equal to the number ÷ 2 because half(1/2) is equal to 1/2 because you divided the original number by 2 which leaves you with 1/2. <n>##

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? Choices:  A: special B: personal C: offended D: unique E: rare<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>

If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would you find fungus growing on something made from milk? Choices:  A: eyes B: biology laboratory C: shower stall D: old cheese E: decaying matter<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option D.<n><n>A: Eyes have tears that wash micro- organisms and debris away from the eye and help to fight off disease so option "A" is not possible.<n><n>B: A biology laboratory would not have fungus growing on it as the room is kept sterile.<n><n>C: The shower stall may be used often and sometimes be kept in places where the air is moist. It is possible that sometimes when the stall is not used for a few days that it could grow mould in the small sections near the floor.<n><n>D: Old cheese moulds for a few reasons. Milk contains lots of sugar which would provide energy for fungus to grow in it or decompose it over a period of time. Also, cheese often sits on shelves or in areas that are kept at room temperature which are suitable for fungi growth. Fungus does not need oxygen to survive it can grow in places where no light can get through it can grow in places that are at all possible moist or damp temperature and are somewhat shaded this would make fungus growth possible inside the cheese.<n><n>E: Decaying matter is almost always moist and has food for fungi to grow upon which is one of the most important things that fungi needs to thrive is for food to be available to eat.

Is this True or False?<n><n>### Response:(F /)<n>### Input:A car drives for a long while, and reaches its destination. It takes 1 hour to charge the car and 3 hours to refill. It takes 45 minutes to check into gas station and 45 minutes to finish refueling. The car needs to be at a station every 10 minutes, or else it will stop working. What is the least amount of time in which all of the cars needs to be done?<n><n>###Response:(60 /)<n>###Input:Scientists have found that people see objects as being more attractive if they are arranged vertically instead of horizontally.  There are 12 chocolate muffins in 1 row.  Each person gets 4 chocolate muffin slices.  Who gets the most chocolate muffing bits if this arrangement is used?<n><n>###Input:In a math class, there are 9 girls and 11 boys. Which is a better representation of the entire class, 9 women and 11 men, 9 girls and 9 boys, or 9 women and 9 men?<n><n>###Output:(D /)<n>###input:The number of people in a classroom is represented by a fraction. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were. So there are 10 days left till Monday. So we have to choose Monday.<n><n>#### Your answer:<n><n>#### Example: Select which day of the week a teacher has a short week, because school has holidays throughout a given week.<n> <n>![](https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?%5Ctext%7BA%3E%3E%5Ctext%3Ashort%20week%5Ctext%5C%2Ftext%7D%3E%3A%20the%20%5Ctext%20number%20of%20days%7C%20since%20the%0Aend%20of%0Athe%20given%20week%0A%2C%20the%5C%20number%0Aof%20the%7C%22lefts%22%20holidays%22%2C0%20and%20%5B%5Ctext%09%5Ctext%9Dstarting%20the%E2%80%9Cnew%20week%E2%83%87%5D%7C%3E) <n><n><n><n>#### Reason for answer: The teacher starts new week with Monday and has holidays on 6 days which will give 2 free days.<n>

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:To prevent any glare during the big football game he made sure to clean the dust of his what? For each instruction, explain how writing clearly is difficult for specific types of learners and why that understanding is helpful when designing accessible and usable content.<n><n>**Instruction:**<n>While learning the different types of sentences, students sometimes become confused because they tend to confuse the parts of speech. Identify the following sentence below and determine whether it is a sentence or a fragment:<n>A: He loves me so much.<n><n>**Response:**<n>Many students struggle to construct sentences with proper syntax, and fragmented sentences can contribute to low writing scores. Explaining that fragmented sentences are a barrier to effective writing allows students to more clearly understand how their skills in this area will affect their writing proficiency.<n><n>**Instructions:**In the following instruction, explain how the prompt and the rubric would help students who are visual or auditory learners.<n><n>**Prompt:**<n><n>Below is the rubric based on a project for you to write a song. Be sure to use the provided links to look through the rubric as you write your song.<n><n>Criteria | Weight | Points Possible<n>--- | --- | ---<n>Rhythm | 20% | 20 points<n>Meter | 20%  | 20 pointsLexis/Sound device | 20%| 20 pointsInclusion of figurative language | 50%| 50 points<n><n>**Rubric: Rhythm: 1. 2.2. 3.4<n>Meter: 2. 2.2 2.2 4 5 5<n>Lexis/Sound Device | 2. 22 5 5<n>Inclusion of figurative Language| 5<n>**Final Score |**50<n><n>**Instructional Responses:**<n><n>**Visual Learner:**<n>Visual learners prefer instructions that provide them with a step-by step process. The rubric presented allows teachers to assess this type of learner because it explicitly outlines each criterion and the points that will be assigned in the final score.<n><n>**Auditory Learner:**<n>Auditory learners prefer to learn information by hearing it. Therefore instructors can provide auditory

If I had the money,I would.....................<n>2. Even if I didn't have money, I would........................<n>3. That's true. I would..........................<n><n><n>## Task Summary 1<n>To answer multiple choice questions, use strategies and sentence frames below.<n><n>**Strategy 1:**<n>Use the following strategies to answer these three questions:<n>1) In your own words (in short sentences), state what the problem is.<n>2) In your own words, write the question on the board, and underline the first word of the question to show the task (the word on which you should focus).<n>3) Find out or figure out (by reading the sentence) the information that will help you answer the question.<n>4) Write the answer at the bottom.<n><n>**Sentence Frame 1:**<n>Let's find out if __ (fill in the missing information)___ matches the situation stated in the problem.<n><n>```<n>Example:<n>Let's find if 1/2 of 2/3 matches the situation stated in 5/9.<n>Answer: It does!<n><n>```<n><n>**Sentense Frame 2:**<n>Let' s think about what............. (give an answer to a different question) would................... (give a specific example

Choices:  A: strip club B: pocket C: millpond D: ontario E: lake or river<n><n>### Response:		A.Strip club<n><n>### Input :How do you find 13 divided by 10 using pencil and paper without a calculator?<n>Write 13. Draw a line to the right of 13. Next, place a bar (a short line) that touches both sides of the pencil mark. Then, draw a line under the bar. Finally, count the spaces between each column of numbers. The space between the top number (1) and the bar (10) is 1. The space between the numbers 3 and 13 is 10. There are 10 spaces in total! We must then divide 10 into 13. Ten divided by 13 is.76923. We can then approximate the answer by turning.7692 into.769. The answer is 13 over 10.<n><n>### Input How do you subtract 0.73 inches from 3.83 inches?<n>The first step to help you subtract an inch from an inch measurement is to draw the centimeter ruler and cross it out, so you can measure accurately the inch (1/16 inch) and the half an inch. 0.5 inches. Next, draw the pencil mark that represents 0.5 inches, and then count the spaces between each inch measurement, and put the 0.5 under the pencil mark, as shown below, we can now see.03 inches. (0.5 minus 0.5).  Next, look for a column of numbers. 0.5 is to the left of 0.5. Finally, subtraction comes in handy 0.13 inches. Lastly, to determine the correct answer to the amount of inches subtracted, (in this case 0.73 in-). We must write our answer next to.13 inches. The answer will be rounded to a whole inch. (rounded off to 0 inches). 0.13 = 0.0<n><n>### Input what is 34860<n>Write a multiplication sentence that uses the following digits: 3 4 8 6 0. 3 x 4 = 12. 6 x 0 = 0. (12)860<n>

C: progress D: transfer of information E: collaboration<n><n>### Response:		static<n>### Explanation<n>A collaboration is a collective effort where the inputs of the group are brought together and made into something new.<n>Because they used to communicate they were not getting any new ideas in their collaboration, thus they were facing a static period.<n><n>### Direction:Analyze the two data sets. Decide which set represents the value that the student is given from the answer to the data set.<n><n>**Input:A:** In the morning, Maria washes the dishes in 25 minutes.  In the afternoon she washes the dishes and cleans up the house in 40 minutes. <n>**Input:B:** Lili washes the dishes for both her and her mother in 40 minutes and she  cleans the house in 50 minutes.<n><n>**Answer:B**<n><n>### Explanatoin<n>As per the data set, the time Lili takes to clean the house is more than hers, so the A stands for Lili.<n><n>However Maria takes less time to clean dishes and more time to clean the house. As per the data set her time taken for cleaning dishes is less than the time she takes to clean the house, therefore she is the same answer as the answer in the A for the answer in the B.<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input<n>100 students who were attending a summer program <n>are asked a question by their instructor.  They are given one minute to write out their answers on notecards.  Once they have written their answers, they are asked to fold their cards over and exchange with students who are sitting next to them. After they have exchanged their answers, they need to put their answers on the chalkboard.  As the students finish writing their answers, they are supposed to erase the previous answer and move to the next card.<n><n>## Explanation<n>As the students receive a question, they can write their answer on the note card in approximately 1 minute. They then exchange their note cards and move on to the next assignment by exchanging the note cards.<n><n>### Exercise<n>The first 35 students to finish writing are each given the same question: What is 1-2 times 34?  The next students who finish writing, receive the same

She adds half of the flour and he adds the other half. She uses the eggs he added for batter and he uses the eggs she added for the cake batter. How many flour eggs did each of them use? Choices: A: 4 B: 3 C: 1 D: She used 4 eggs, he used 1 egg. E: He used 4 eggs, she used 1 egg.<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Description<n>The request asks for the number of eggs used by the two people baking the cakes together. The person has to think of two options, one where flour is halved and eggs shared between Corey and Tapanga, and another option where flour is halve and eggs shared between Tapanga and the person. You have to find out whether they used 1 or 4 eggs.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>**Answer:**<n><br><n>**Choice option A** <br><n>**Answer and Explanation:** We know in the first case Corey added half the flour and Tapanga added the other half of the flour. So he must have added 2 eggs of the total of 4 eggs as 1 egg is used for batter and 3 are used for cake. But Tapanga must have used only 2 eggs as 1 go for batter while the other 3 are used for the cakes. So he gave half of 4 which is 2 eggs to Tapanga and she used 4 eggs.<n>Now, the second case is Tapanga halves the flour again and they share amongst themselves. He must have added 1 egg each and Tapanga shares the other 3 eggs.<n>Thus, the total eggs used by them are 4, and option A is the correct choice.<n><n><n><n><br><n><n>**Answer: Choice option D for the question** Input: Tapanga and Tane are baking cakes on the same day. She uses her electric stove and he uses his gas stove. Their kitchens are connected, and they both prepare cakes in the same amount of time and use the same ingredients. What happens to the relative temperature of their cakes? Choices: A. It doesn't matter B: Their cakes
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:I'm looking for alcohol and fried foods, any suggestions? Choices:  A: pub B: plane C: beer D: store E: fraternity house<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>John and Mike are playing tennis.  On the first serve, John hits the ball 1 meter to his right, and on Mike's serve, he hits the ball 6 meters to his left. If you throw a ball from your 2.6 meter mark to John's 1 meter mark, how far away is it from the return?<n><n>### Response<n>2.6 meter mark –  1 meter mark = 1.6 meter mark – 1 meter mark<n><n>### Input <n>John is throwing a box at Mike, who must catch it without it dropping. John has to throw the box at Mike when Mike is 0.5 meters away from him. Mike is 1.9 meters tall. Will Mike catch the box?<n><n>### Expected<n><n>If Mike is 1.19 meters (19 cm + 5 cm) away from John (1.9 meters – 0.5 meters), then he must move to be able to catch the box. At the closest he moves to John (1.5 meters away), if the box is thrown straight at him, its centre of gravity will fall 0.45 meters from Mike’s fingertips (1.19 – 1.5).<n><n>### Input :<n>John's sister is throwing him a ball but it won’t land at the same level since she threw it at the same moment she started a ladder.  The ball will be 5.25 meters high if the distance from the top of the ladder to where it lands is 17 meters.<n><n>### Response :<n>  5.25 meters- 17 meters  <n>  5.2  <n><n>### Input =The distance between the houses on either side of the street is 75 meters. The distance from the street to the house is the same for all houses.<n>    <n>### Response = 62.5 meters<n><n>### Input=Sarah wants to plant 5 fruit trees in each row so that each tree is evenly spaced from the other trees (with a distance between each tree of 10 meters).  <n>    <n>### Expected Response=5 fruit trees need to be planted in each row and 5 rows of trees need to be plantd in order to be evenly spaced.<n><n>10

Now there are X apples."  What is this an example of? Choices:  A: park B: coloring book C: garden center D: math problem E: gravity<n><n>### Response:		The number of apples on the tree, 10, is the known, or fixed, value. The number of apples that fall off the tree, 3, is the unknown, or variable, value. After subtracting 3 from 10, 7 is the answer.<n><n>### Input: How many apples are on an apple tree? <n><n>### Response:"On"<n><n>### Instructions:The following are examples of questions that could appear on a math tests. For each question, choose the choice that best answers the question.<n><n>## EQUATIONS<n>### 5 boys + 5 girls = 6 X 5 ?  boys 10 girls <n>### x+x+x=2x? 2x x 2x <n>### (4x + 9)?  (4x - 9) <n><n>### TRIANGLES<n>### Is the triangle shown Isosceles trapezoid <n>### Angles x and Z should be less than 90 degrees? 180 degrees <n>### Angle x should be congruent to 30 degrees? 38 degrees <n><n>### PROBLEMS <n>### If the cost of renting a movie is $3.00, what is the cost of renting three movies? 9 dollars <n>### If a toy car runs $12.80, how many dollars does it cost to get 18 toy cars and 2 car batteries? $50 <n> <n>### <n><n>![Mathematical Operations](https://cdn.mathsteacher.org/images/math-image1.gif)<n><n>### The number 102 is more than one-third of the number 347. What number is one-third of 102? 113<n><n>

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. Choices:  A: radio station B: recording studio C: concert D: tv studio E: new york<n><n>### Response:		Choice:  mic boom and microphone are used at a recording studio<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answers the question using "I" statements (i.e., sentences that begin with the word "I").<n><n>- Answers the question using "We" statements (i. e., sentences that begin with "We").<n><n>- Use an analogy to explain something (i.e., compare something to another similar thing).<n><n>- Use a simile to explain something (i. e., compare something to something).<n><n>- Use examples to explain or give evidence for your answer.<n><n>### Input : What is the best response to the scenario?<n>"I just learned about this website and I don't want to be spammed. I'm getting this strange email."<n>-A: I'll put you on my spam list so you don't get that email again.<n>-B: I've never used the website you're talking about so I don't know about it.<n>-C: You're right. That sounds like spam. I won't sign you up<n>### Response: <n>I(We) know what it's like to get too many emails. I do not want to get emails again. Can you not sign me up?<n><n>### Instructure: In each of the following scenarios, write a response to the given question. <n><n>### Input<n>What is the best response given the scenario?<n>"Matthew, I saw your new clothes in your new bag just outside your house. I saw you take the bag inside your house."<n>-A: <n>-B: <n>-C: <n>-D: <n>-E: <n><n><n>### Response<n><n>E. <n>"I was with my girlfriend in her house when we arrived and I took the bag in. Thank you for caring."<n><n>## Input<n>Lilly wants to help the poor children by selling cookies. To save money, she bought 2 lb of brown sugar and will mix it with 2 1/2 lb of cookies. He could be somewhere else. This is the least amount of options. <n><n><br /><br /><n>If C - we are saying he is in the middle ages. Choices:  A: cold B: unfamiliar C: unknown D: unacquainted E: shy<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Demonication:<n>Demonstration: Mary isn't comfortable speaking to James because she isn't familiar with James. <n><n>Below is a dialog using words from your reading. Use your reading as a guide to respond to the prompt.<n><n>### Dialog:<n>* A: "Hello! How are you?" * B: "Good. And you?" * A: "Fine." (This is a non-contextual question and answer.)<n><n>### Questions to the Dialog:<n>* What is A's tone?<n>* How would a friendly and familiar interaction like this be carried out?<n>* How would this conversation sound if both people were familiar with each other? <n><n>Below are two different responses, with different tones and attitudes.<n><n>### Response #1:A: "Hello! How's it going?" * B: "Great. And you?" A: "Terrific."<n><n>### Response#2:<n>A: "Hello! <n>B: "Good to see you, *insert name*.  Hope all is well."<n><n>### Question:<n>What can you infer about how these interactions are different? What do you assume based on these sentences?<n>Response:<n>It gives the impression (what the speaker meant) that the speaker's in a good mood. It gives the impression (what I assume the speaker meant) that they are familiar with the speaker.<n><n>### Writing Task:<n>Your response should include these characteristics when asked a question.<n><n>#### Tone<n>The tone is friendly.<n><n>#### Actions, gestures and body language<n>The speaker is familiar with the listener.<n><n>#### Attitude<n>The sentence is given in the first person.<n><n>### Evaluation:<n><n>### Instructions: <n>Answer the following written response.<n><n><n>### Instructon:<n>Answers the following short-answer response.<n><n>### Question #1:<n>  The speaker and listener are familiar with one another.<n>  The speaker and the listener have similar tones.<n>  The relationship between the speaker and the listener is that of a friend.<n><n>### The response should be at least one paragraph (three sentences) describing the above.<n><n>### Short Answer:<n>The speaker and the listener are familiar with one anothers and have

Choices:  A: sun B: sky C: candle D: house E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		A sun source or a sky source is most likely to be a candle.<n><n>### Explanation: A candle is often associated with light coming out of the sky. Thus, A sun source or a candle is the most likely to be the correct answer.<n><n>### Input<n>If I have an open source application in my possession, what am I likely to use to develop more software for it? Choices: 	A: open source application B: programming language C: framework D: debugger<n><n>### Response<n>In all likelihood, a programming language is the best pick for an open source application.<n><n>### Analysis<n>In this case, "develop" implies writing more software. An open source application is an application that was written by the community or was developed using an open source program. "Open source application" is the first choice.<n><n>### Conclusion<n>The most likely pick is, an open source application is written using a programming language. "To develop" refers to writing more software. Thus, the most likely answer is a programming language.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:If you have trouble beginning work you're suffering from what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: excitement C: tiredness D: progress E: procrastination<n><n>### Response:		A is the correct answer.<n><n>### Input<n><n>If you have trouble beginning your work you're suffering through what? Choose from A: sitting down, B: excitation, C: tiredness, D: progress and E: procrastinating.<n><n>### Response<n><n>I can't believe you still don't know what you're talking about. If you're having trouble beginning your work you are not suffering from what? Choose from sitting down, excitement, tiredness, progress and procrastinating<n><n>### Input You are working on a problem that requires you to place a positive, negative, and zero into any one of three box labeled 1, 2, and 3.<n><n>### Choices: All boxes contain positive numbers because negative = negative one in two's complement.<n><n>### Box 1: -4<n><n>### Box2: -2<n><n>### Box3: 0<n><n>### Response 33<n><n>### Instructions: Place x in the left-hand labeled blank that makes the function "e" equal to the right-hand labeled blank.<n><n>### Ex) e^3<n>### Write y if 3 is in the given function.<n>### e3 = ye ^3 = y<n><n>### If you were given any one of the below functions what would the blank box contain<n><n>### 1x^2 +2x<n>### (2x)^2+5x<n>### -3(2x)2<n>### e^x<n>### e^5<n><n>### Instutution:<n>Place some type in the blank in the denominator and the exponent in the numerator that will make the following fraction equal to 2/3.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>### Solution 1<n>### Put the 2 in the fraction place<n>### Put the -1 in the denominator<n>### 2 -2/3 = 2<n>## Solution 2<n>### Put -1 in the denominater<n>### 2+3+4 = 9<n>## Solution 3<n>### Put -4 in the denominator<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>Place a letter in the blank to the left that makes the sentence on the right true.<n><n>## Solution 1<n><n>###

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What is a lover likely to want to do with their partner? Choices:  A: build family together B: fall in love C: make love D: complete E: distance themselves<n><n>### Response:		How does this function work?<n><n>* *Includes a screenshot of the prompt above or your explanation of what the input looks like.<n>* Includes a screenshot of the calculator.<n>* Includes your own solution written in plain English.<n>* Includes an explanation of how the solution works.

Choices:  A: sickness B: motion sickness C: relocation D: jet lag E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		What often happens after long travel?<n><n>A. This response choice is not correct because sickness and motion sickness are the opposite of being healthy, which is the opposite of being sick.<n><n>B. This response choice is incorrect because the choices do not relate with relocation in any way, nor are the choices incompatible with being sick or travel sick.<n><n>C. This response choice is incomplete because you have to add relocation to the sentence.<n><n>D. This response choice is correct.<n><n>E. This response choice is wrong because this refers to feeling the effects of tiredness, which occurs when you are relocated, and is incompatible with jet lag, which occurs after long travel from an overseas location.<n>

The performance space is called a stage.<n><n>Input:A grizzly bear is in a den underneath a platform that is overhangs a lake. The bear is adapted to find food in this environment because the animal is very large with heavy bones. The bear is walking along or on a platform.<n><n>### Input : A magician is planning to perform a simple illusion. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. One is brown and the other is very small. You hear him ask, "which dog do you like the most?" "Uhm...", said the boy in embarrassment. He did not have to choose, they were the same!<n>### Response:(C- Two, so I like them both. )<n><n>### Instuct: There are a group of people looking to adopt a cat. One person walks in and declares their cat is the cat that they've been seeing in a dream.<n><n>### Option 1: It's a beautiful cat.<n>### Answer: (D- This is your cat)<n>### Option 2: It's a cat but I've never seen you before.<n>### Answer:(C- Maybe it's not my cat)<n>### Instruct : Tina and Jack are watching the same television program at the very same time. You subtract 129 and get to 122, so you do the reverse process to 121 and get to 130.<n><n>For B, I would subtract negative 1 if I'm subtracting negative 14, which will bring me to the number that is less than 129.<n><n>Also, you could simply try each number and see which one works. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What happens to the next appointment when a grooming takes longer than expected? Choices:  A: injury B: beauty C: late D: mistakes E: annoyed<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:(For each of the following scenarios, write what happens to the next appointment.)<n>Scenario 1: Nicole's grooming took longer than expected, so she's not ready for her next client's appointment. What happens to the next appointment?<n>Scenarios 3:  The groomers cannot start the next scheduled appointment because they have an issue with the next customer that takes longer to resolve than expected. What happens to the grooming appointment?<n>Answer: None of the above<n><n>### InputThe dog's grooming appointment took longer than expected. The store needs help handling the stock that is arriving, and you cannot afford to hire more than one employee. The budget you were given is $16 an hour for salary. You also need help working on the register, and the manager of that department told you that you would have to pay her an additional $16 an hour. She also told you to add $8 per hour to her salary if she works more than 40 hours. How much will you need to pay the employee if she works 50 hours in a week?<n><n>### Instructor's Solution<n>You will have to add $8 per overtime hours so<n>$16(hours work) + $8(over time hours) = total salary<n>Salary will be = $16(hours worked) + 8(overtime hours) = 16 + 8 = $24<n>### Output: Total salary =$24.00 per hour<n>

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. He ate part of the cake and gave the rest to his mom and his brother. How much did he give away?<n><n>## Response 1:<n>Buddy took half the cake and gave 1/4 to his mom and 1/6 to his brother.<n><n>## Response 2:<n>Buddy ate 1/6 and gave the rest to mom and brother.<n><n>Response 1 is incorrect because he ate part of the ice cream before giving any to his brother or mom. Response 2 is incorrect because he aired the cake and ice crem after giving some to his mom and brother. Response 3 is incorrect because he aire the cake and ice cram after giving some to his brother and mom. He should air both after his brother and mom.<n><n>## Task2:<n>Complete the statement.<n>You can solve this problem using data analysis, drawing a picture, or explaining with text.<n>## Input :<n>There are 11 kids in Amy’s class. 5 of them want ice cream at the ice cream truck, 1 of them wants cotton candy, 2 of them want hot dogs, 2 of them only want a treat, and 1 other child wants to stay at school. Choices; <n><n>    I am very good at working in a group.<n>    I enjoy doing research.<n><n>##### Response; <n><n>    (A) I am very good at workin a group<n>    (B) I enjoy doing research <n><n>##### Below are several items that have been lost over the week.<n><n>A. 1 pair of jeans <n><n>      B. 1 shirt <n>      <n>      C. 1 binder <n>      <n>      D. 1 phone <n>      <n>      E. 1 laptop<n>      F. 1 toothbrush<n><n>##### Response  <n><n>    (A): 1 pair of jean <n>    (B): 1 shirt  <n>    (C): 1 binder  (D): 1 phone (E): 1 laptop (F): 1 toothbr<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:There weren't enough chairs for everyone.  What might have to be delayed? Choices:  A: bookstore B: building C: meeting D: office E: coffeehouse<n><n>### Response:		The meeting could not happen at that time.<n>

When I took birth control pills, I used to store them in my drawer as they were in a container.<n><n>### Final Note: Please do not post a response that has already been answered.<n>

Choices:  A: bookstore B: backpack C: abraham lincoln's grave D: desktop E: classroom<n><n>### Response:		<n>*Notebooks are not found in the bookstores.*<n>*It's located in the backpacks.*<n>*Notebooks can be found in Abraham Lincoln's grave.*<n>*It is sometimes found on a desk or in a classroom.*<n>*To the desktop you always return.*<n><n>### Demostration:<n>*Notebook: a book filled with writing space.*<n>*We have a bookstore?*<n>*Where do you buy your notebook?*<n>*Buying notebook in bookstore*<n><n>### Input<n>Juju has $33. He invests $4.56 into a stock and sells it for $29.15. He then invests the remaining amount, buying $5.41 of stock. Finally, he sells the stock and receives $38.87 for his remaining money.<n><n>How much money did Juju end up with?<n><n>### Demotion:<n>*If he gets $4.56 from the first investment.*<n>*If he invests $5.41 in the next one.*<n>*The stock is $29.13. So the total is $38.83.*<n><n>### Input and Demonstation<n>We can find something using different ways such as, counting, sorting, grouping, and matching.<n><n>### Input One<n>A pencil factory ordered 100 cases of pens. A case holds 24 pens. One of the cases breaks open during transportation. What was the ratio of broken cases to working cases? <n><n>### Demontation One<n>In this case, the number of broken cases over the total number of cases works. The broken cases was equivalent to the total number of cases which is 24.<n><n>### Two ways to find what is given in a number<n>* If we group items according to a particular characteristic, they will be similar to the ones that you grouped in order to find out what we are looking for. For example, when you sort coins, they will be sorted according to their type like dollars, quarters, dimes, etc.<n>* If we match items in any way that helps you recognize them, you will still remember them. You have to pick the items that were given to your memory. There are three ways to do this: By sight, by sound,

(round to the nearest whole dollar)<n>### Response : The rate would be 1.12

Lawyers<n><n>### Input:(3-step subtraction)112 56 - 39 = 2<n><n>## <n># Input:Tapanga and Corey  share 66 candies  Tapanga has 2 more candies than Core<n><n>### Correct response:<n>Corey has 45 candies<n><n>### Input:"The bus takes me to the school in 20 mintues if I am in a hurry."<n><n>### Correct:<n>I am in a hurry.<n><n>### Input:-342 = -7(50+(-100)) = -7(44)<n><n>### Correct responce:<n>-7(44) = -258<n>### Input:-4-10= -6<n><n>### Responce:<n>Incorrect<n>> -4-10 will equal to -16 so, the response will be -16<n><n>### Input(+,-)*(-3,15,-5,100)<n><n>### Response (Step1):<n>Add -5 and 15. -10 will be left.<n>(Step2):<n>Then subtract -100 from 100. -90 will be left. <n>(Step3):<n>-50 + -90 = -110<n><n>### Input(-15, -40)<n><n>## Response:<n>Add both the numbers the last digit will turn to 8, which is less than the second number. She leaves the station at 4 pm to her vacation place. She arrives at her place at 6pm. So it will take her to travel 9hours in total.<n><n>### Input 3<n><n>How long did it take them to travel to Hawaii?<n><n>### Response 3<n>To travel to hawaii, it takes the flight 5 hours.<n>To return, it takes them almost 2 hours.<n>So the total flying time for both ways is 7 hours.<n><n>### <n>

The result is evenly divisible by the GFM/LDM if it cannot be zero or not greater than it"<n><n>### Insturction.  : How did the students in the previous exercise change to make sure the answer was in simplest form?<n><n>### Answer.  : Subtacted the greatest common factor from each term in the first, second, and fourth denominators and the greatest common factor in the fifth denminator, and then moved all of the numbers that remained to the second step up from the bottom. <n><n>### Instraction : When converting the fraction to a decimal, how many digits should be used as numbers after the decimal point

Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Answer: B<n><n>#### Explanation:<n><n>### Input : What is the volume of a rectangular prism with three faces of 10 square feet, two faces of 9 square feet, and one face of 2 square feet?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Answer: 179<n><n>#### Explanution:<n><n>Volume can be calculated by:<n>(length x width x height/1000 x 1000)<n><n>**(10 x 10 x 9)/(1000 times 1000)(1000)*9*10(1000)*10*10<n>**=(10 x 19 x 9)/(<n><n>10)/(100)=190<n><n>***Note: 100 cm3 = 1Ltr<n><n>**(190/100) =19L<n><n>**(1* 10) =10m^<n><n>**19(10)=190m<n><n>**(9/100)*10 =0.9 =9m<n><n>**=19(10)+9(10)<n><n>**=189+9=198 = 179<n>***<n><n>### Output : Which food would you not take to a picnic? Choices: A: peanut B: corn C: soy D: wheat E: rye<n><n>### Response :<n><n>#### Answer: A<n><n>#### Explanition :<n><n>As food items contain proteins, vitamins, minerals and other essential nutrients which are required for the regular functions of the human body. They are of help for the growth and development of infants and children as well as they are also essential in warding off diseases and ailments to adults.<n><n>#### Duration :<n>

Calculate the total number of puppies that Nalani give away in that event.<n><n>**Question:** 7<n>**Answer:** 15<n><n>### Input<n>1. Sam's teacher asked if any of the class wants to have a pet. Sam's teacher is keeping track of how many in the class want a pet at any time. Write an expression, in terms of the variable t, that describes the number of students that would want a pet in any given time.<n><n>`t^4-t^2+1`<n><n>2. Sam likes to go swimming.
