Sam likes to swipe there every day, but if it costs more than$2.75, he doesn't go that day. Write an expression to find out how much does sam is going to spend when he goes to the swimming pool? The expression should be in terms of a variable called t.<n><n>`t+14`<n><n>2.Sam likes to buy a 3-pound box of raisins. In his last purchase, he bought 2 pounds of raisins

One time all his passengers are people that came for a conference and they don't want to ride together. He charges an extra $5 for being alone and pays a 8.4$ per minute for each of his passengers waiting. He drives them to the conference which is 4km away, and they want to be dropped off at places that are at least 0.6km apart from one another.  A man is dropped off at a museum at 1km and is charged 6$ for the ride, he asks how much he is charged for the ride and then drops him back home. Then a women is dropped off at the same place and is dropped back home as well. The man asks the exact same question and the driver, for some reason, also charges him 6$ every minute he is in the taxi. The woman is dropped off next at a coffee shop and asks how much she is charged for the ride. The taxi driver only charges her for riding once. When dropping her back to the apartment she wants to go, her asks her how much she has to pay. The last man is dropped off at the coffee shop and asked what he is charged for the service. He asks the driver when they will get to the place and he says it will take about 20 minutes, which is when the price rises to $16. How much did the coffee shop pay for the ride?<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Conclusions: The coffee shop paid 9 dollars for the ride.<n><n>### Reference Link: https://github.com/google-research-datasets/google-research--datas

If Corey has twice as many candies as Tapanga, what can be the total number of candies that Tapanga and Coreys have?<n><n>### Correct answer: 26<n><n>### Output/Input:<n>`How many dollars did Freddy spent calling his family on New Years Eve? There are 37 hours in 8 days, and Freddy talked for 27 minutes on a local call and 30 minutes on an international call.`<n><n>### Correct Answer: 10<n>### Explanation:<n>`There are 37 hours each day and Freddy used 30 minutes calling someone from the other side of the globe, it would be 37 x 30, giving us a final total of 1090, and 1090-5= 1085, but 1085-25=1059. And the final answer would be 10.`<n><n>### Outputs/Inputs:<n>`If the total pounds of corn are 2 less than six times the total pounds of peaches, how many pounds of peaches and how many pounds of corn are there all together? The total peaches and total pounds. The peach and total corn.`<n><n>```python<n>pounds of peach=input("Please input the pounds of peach.")<n>pounds of corn = input("Pounds of corn")<n><n>total=pounds+pounds+pounds<n>sub=pounds+punshes<n><n>if sub>pounds:<n>        for x in range (sub-pounds):<n>                x2=x*2<n>total=total+x2<n>total=total/6<n><n>output='peach is '+str(total)+' pounds of pear is '+str(sub+pounds)<n>print(output)<n>```<n><n>### Output<n>`peach is 105 pounds of pear is 300 pounds`<n><n>### Explanatory answer<n>`We need to find the total pounds that peach has and then divide it by six, because it has more of a peach in all

After 5 minutes, you're feeling weighed down so you decide to turn around and walk back home for 30 minutes. But when you're walking back, you start to feel really bad, so you decide to walk faster and end up being in your neighborhood in 43 minutes. How far away are you?<n><n>### Respones: C<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. If the statement is false the next statement should be an alternative yes statement.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Instrtuction: Answer True of False<n>True because there are many people that have multiple rulers that is used to measure things.<n><n>### Output:<n>Therefore true.<n><n>### Incorrect response:<n>False because there are not many people that have multiple rule used to measure things. Therefore false.<n><n><n><n>### Sample questions<n><n>### What is 7/5?<n>8<n><n>### Name 4 types of food<n>Fruits, Vegetable, Meat, Grains.<n><n>### If you have 3 marbles and you roll the same set of 2 every time, what is the chance that it will be a different set of 2?<n>75%<n><n>### How many dogs are there in a "pack"?<n>The number "pack" is related to, is, and was originated to be a colloquialism, a general term for a group. Since it is general in meaning, there is no definite answer.<n><n>### How much do I weigh?<n>250 pounds<n><n>### What am I?<n>I am an animal.<n><n>### Is there a "Nature's way?"<n>No because nature is a general term used for any process or event that happens in the world that is not caused or influenced by anything else. Therefore no one way is specifically given to show nature's way.<n><n>### What do you need to go grocery shopping?<n>You need the grocery shopping essentials.<n><n>### Name a store for groceries.<n>Costco and Walmart.<n><n>### Can you use a flashlight at night?<n>Yes, you can use a flashlight at a night. North<n><n>## Answer<n><n>South, 35 minutes<n><n>## Instructions:In each of the problems below, you will receive a statement or question about data. For each problem below, you must use the data to write the correct answer.<n><n>## Instrux:John ran five more miles than Mike, but Mike ran three more miles than Jake. How many miles did John run?<n><n>## Answer:<n><n>John ran five miles more than both Jake and Mike combined. 33 (Jake + Mike) - 28 (John).<n><n>## InstruX:A bat and ball cost $1.10 in total. The bat costs $1 more than the ball. How much does the ball cost?<n><n>## AnswerX: 0.80 (1.10 - 1.00)<n><n>## InstruCTION:How much would it cost to buy six dozen eggs? A dozen eggs cost $8. How much does each egg cost?<n><n>## InstructionA:<n><n>Six dozen = 72 1/2 (1 dozen = 1 dozen eggs => 1 dozen eggs = 100 cents)<n>72 * 100 = 7200 cents, 72 cents per dozen<n><n><n>## InstructionB:<n><n>Each Egg costs 10 cents, 1/2 dollar - 1/2 a doll

He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a movie theater along with other stores in one placE? Choices:  A: downtown area B: urban area C: new york city D: shopping mall E: military base<n><n>### Response:		Answer E<n><n>### Instraction:Answers the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: It would take 10 days to build a building if each of the 5 bricklayers worked 5 days per week. However, if each bricklayer worked 10 hours a day and 5 bricklayers worked, would this building take longer or shorter to be built? __Answer__: Shorter<n><n>Input: 86% of the people in a room have brown hair. 13% of the people in the room have black hair. 23% of the people have blonde hair. What fraction of the people have blond hair? __Answer__: 0.23<n><n>Input: Shannon wants to use the square root to solve the equation $15x+5x^2+15=0$. The answer is $x=1$. __Answer__: True<n><n>Input: When using the quadratic formula to solve an equation, you get the answer $b\bigtriangleup.c$ (meaning you square the number on the left and add it to the number on the right). __Answer__: True.<n><n>Input: When solving for $x$ in a quadratic equation when you have just the standard form $ax^2+bx+c=0$, you have to solve for the equation $ax^2+(b/a)x+c = 0$ and then isolate x __Answer__: True and $ax^2+(c/b)x+c=0$<n><n>Input: When a quadratic equation is in a form of $x^2 + px + q$ it is possible to solve for $x$. __Answer__: False<n><n>Input:  When a quadratic equation is written in standard form, $ax^2 + bx + c$, it does not require one more step to be solved to the formula  $x (n+1)(2n+1)$ __Answer__: True <n><n>Input: The expression $2(x^2 + 2x - 4)$ can be written using the form $ax^2 + abx + q$. __Answer__:  False.<n><n>Input: If $2x^2 +11x +13\le 0$ and we want to solve it for the value of x, what operations might we do? __

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Why might someone want to be buying beer? Choices:  A: make noise B: have tea C: make time D: make payments E: take time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If the bank accepts only D then you can add only amount of time.<n><n>Answer:<n><n>* A only<n>* E only<n><n>### Input : It's noon and there are 32 students studying in a class. 11 of the 32 students are girls.  Among the 11 students, exactly 3 are boys. Of the 11 students that are girls, 6 are younger than 10 years old and 7 are older than 13 years old.  How many students are older than 14 years old?<n><n>### Demostration :<n><n>Input: 11 of the students are girls. Then, 3 of the 11 students are boys. Then 6 among the 11 students who are girls are younger than 13 years and 7 among the 11 are older than 10 years.  Therefore, there are 6+7+3+3 students (1+2+3+4).  So, among all the 32 students, there are 4 students who are older than 12 years.<n><n>Different way to solve :<n><n># Number of girls = 11<n><n># Boys in Girls = 3<n><n># Boys not in Girls = 3 <n><n># Girls less than 10 = 6 <n><n># Girls greater than 10 = Girls in Girls - Girls less than 13 = 6 + (11-6) = 3 <n> <n># Aged people = 6+7+4 = 17<n><n># How many people are aged less than 10+How many ate aged greater than?<n><n># How many are greater than 10?<n><n># So, How many people are greater than 12?(10-3)<n><n># So, Age = 12 <n><n>### Response answer: 30<n><n>### Input :- There are many places to find gold. You can find gold while prospecting, in the earth, or you can dig it up and clean it after it has been found. Gold is found in quartz veins, lode deposits, and in placer deposits (sand, gravel, and other deposits). Gold is found in South Dakota, Nevada, Alaska, California, and Colorado.

So the question you should ask yourself is how do you know you have the right answer? In all cases where you try to compute the answer, if the result is reasonable given what you were taught, then you may have found the right answer. This is what computer scientists call an "intuition pump" - a way to quickly assess which answers are reasonable.<n><n>### Input -> I am a good guesser, when I do something I generally have a correct idea of what I'm doing, I often find my reasoning is too short or too long, but I have a good idea of what I'll be doing next, I usually come up with the right answer in a second when I decide what to do in programming, I like the problem solving skill, I am good at it and I can always come up with unique solutions, I like solving problem.<n>### Input ->I like problem solving because it gives you an opportunity to think outside the box and to expand on your critical thinking skills, I often get the wrong answer and I make mistakes, but the more I practice, the less mistakes I make, it's satisfying making mistakes and finding a way to fix and solve the problem. <n><n>##

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Write an If-Then statement that completes the request. The task will be given in the following way:<n>If the following conditions apply, then answer is x. Otherwise, answer is y<n><n>### Instructions:If the following conditions apply and I am happy, then I should go to Hawaii.<n>Otherwise, I should go to London.<n><n>### Inputs<n>I have already planned a trip.<n><n>I have enough money.<n><n>I want to travel alone.<n><n>### Response<n>IF THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS APPLY AND I AM HAPPY, THEN I SHOULD GO TO HAWAII<n>Otherwise, I  SHOULD GO<n><n>### Instrument:Use a conditional statement to write a response. You have 10 seconds.<n>### Input:Write a conditional statement that completes the following sentence.<n>IF (something) THEN (another thing)<n><n>### Output:<n>IF  BATS USE MICE AS A SOURCE OF FOOD BUT MICE DON'T USE BATS AS A SOURCE FOR FOOD  THEN THEY MAY COLLAPSED TO CREATE AN INTERDEPENDENCE RELATIONSHIP<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>1. IF the sky is blue then I'm happy ELSE I'm sad<n>2. IF the weather is sunny then I'm happy<n><n>### Instuments:Use a conditional statement and write a response. Give the following code a single keyword. You will be given 1 second to do so.<n><n>### Output<n>IF IF THEN ELSE  ELSE  END IF  END IF<n><n>IF a=3 THEN b=0 ELSE b=2 END IF<n><n>### Demointation:<n>If p=2 then q is 0 else q=4.<n><n>### Solution:<n>IF Q=0 THEN P=3 END IF<n><n>## Instructions:Input the following scenario and respond to the prompt that corresponds to it.<n>A plane is flying from Seattle to Los Angeles. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where could a fungus grow and not be disturbed by sunlight? Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would choose C because funguses grows most underground since sunlight and sun rays are too much for them.<n><n>### Input : How can a rocket achieve the greatest velocity? Choices:  a.: in space, b.: on land without changing elevation, c.: on water without changing direction, d.: on earth by making turns.<n><n>### Response :<n>c. It would not achieve the greatest velocity in space. On water it would achieve the least velocity. On Earth the rocket would have to make turns.<n><n>## :two_men_shaking_hands: Assessment :two_men_fist_bumping:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:He made another call, he did this all day hoping people would what well to his offer? Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The correct response is "answer" ("What well", instead, is British understatement for "care") or "respond".<n><n>### Input 1<n>>  It takes 1/2 hour for refrigeration dough to come to temperature.  It takes fifteen minutes to shape the doth and three the proof.  It takes twenty five minutes to proof.  The crust takes fifteen minutes to bake and ten minutes to cool. If the bakery open at 6:06 am, what is the last time the head baker could make it to the store.<n><n>### Response<n>Answer is 'B'<n><n>### Examplan<n>This is a question of how long a single step takes in a recipe before being finished. Each step takes a specific amount of time, the head baker wants to know the time.<n>The input says<n>It takes 1/2 hours for refrigeration to come to temper,<n>1/2 hours to bake and 2 to cool, the steps are<n>1/2 hour to come to temper<n>15 min to bake<n> 15 mins to cool<n>To get the time total all of the steps are taken together and added up. This is to make sure the head baker got to the store on time and not early or late by even a minute.<n><n>### Input<n>There are 8742 students in SAS district, if the schools closes two students come to our school daily that is 10.5 percent of the students in the district. What is the size of the total school district?<n>The answer is 'A'<n><n>### Solution<n>To find the solution multiply the answer 8748 by 0.09, 9 is the coefficient for 10.5% of 99 is one hundred and one, 10.5 is 100 and if one goes to 9 or 19 the next number is1.<n><n>### Exemplan<n>101=99 *(0.9)=99 * 9/10 so the answer is 99 * 9 which is 8748, or when you think of it as 81/6.<n><n>### A B C D E<n>The answer is B<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Four times 225 is 8625 and five times 225 equals 11300. What is 6 times 225? Write the correct answer using digits in only one column.<n><n>### Answer:<n>The answer is 2<n><n>## Exercise 4<n>**Question:**<n>Writing a function<n><n>**Instruction:**<n>Write a function that accepts an integer number as the first parameter, and a boolean as the second parameter.  If the integer equals 0, the boolean should return true, otherwise false. Write a call to the function to check if the function's return value is true or false.<n>```<n>fn zeroOrFalse(n: int, b: bool): bool<n>```<n><n>**Answer:**<n><n>```<n>fn zero_or_false(n: int, boolean: bool): bool<n>{<n>    if (n == 0) { return (boolean) }<n>    else { return (boolean == false) }<n>}<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would there be many people sitting in chair and listening to religious speech? Choices:  A: auditorium B: office C: synagogue D: confession E: church<n><n>### Response:		Answer E: church<n><n>Auditorium <n><n>1. Auditory<n>2. Listening<n>3. Audience <n><n><n>Office <n><n>1. Office <n>2. Conference <n>3. Listening <n><n>Synagogue <n><n>1. Shul <n>2. Listening <n>3. Congregation <n><n>Confession <n><n>1. Penitent <n>2. Priest <n>3. Confessant<n><n>Church <n><n>1. Confessant <n>2. Confessional <n>3. Congegational<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. Find the number of bills in his wallet without the new bill.<n><n>### Response<n><n>After reading the problem and the instructions, I was pretty sure that we were only to deal with the 1.00 bill.  I looked at the problem to solve and first added all the 1.0 bill and all the 1.5.  I realized that 00 would make a new change and I had to subtract the new 1.00, but also need to count the 1.0.  So after the problem I remeasured it to make sure that I was right.<n><n>The answer was 39.<n>

They can either do 1 and 4, or 3 and 2. But they can't do 5 and both 1 and 4.@If you do 1 and 3, you will receive a 9. If you do them both, you will receive a perfect score.@6 of 10<n><n>### Input(@P) In the story problem about two students finishing certain assignments, which student would get an 8 if they finished both assignments?<n><n>### Question about the instructions<n>Input:(Numerical)"@P is the student whose name is"<n><n>### Input(:(Textual))@P is the student in school who did not finish one of the two homework assignments. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where is a fox likely to be caught? Choices:  A: tennessee B: inside joke C: grassy field D: the forrest E: england<n><n>### Response:		Tapanga and Corey share a candy jar equaling 66 candies. Corey, however, has 8 more candes than Tapanga, so he has 29 candes.<n><n>### Inputs:Freddy called both his family and friends. He called his dad for 45 minutes, and his brother for 31 minutes, and he only spent 5 cents for local calls, and 5 for international calls. Therefore his total amount of money was 10 dollars.<n><n>### Response F:Michael has 6 birds and two houses. Since the cost is $22 for a large birdhouse, $7 for a small birdhouse, it will cost 11 dollars to build two bird houses. His total amount of money he made is 97 dollars.<n><n>## Election Protocols <n>* Part One<n><n>### 1. You will be assigned 6 questions where you need to come up with a short, appropriate answer. <n><n>### 2. In a different thread on the same thread, create the answer for a different student. The answer should NOT be copied from the other student!<n><n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question by submitting your response in a different thread of the same question. <n><n>## Demonstration: <n>Input 1: The local supermarket received 400 cases of oranges and 100 cases of grapefruits. If they sold 25 orange cartons and 15 grapefruit cartons per day, how many total apples were there total in store?<n><n>> Answer: 2500<n><n><n>Input 2: Darius had cake batter that was supposed to be used to make cupcakes, but some of the cake batter was given to Aaron to make a cake, and part of the batter was used to make little cakes for the party.  If there was 506 grams of cake batter, how much extra would it take to make 32 cupcakes, 14 cakes, and 24 little cakes?<n><n>#### Response: <n>Both responses were copied from the student.  Both responses need to be changed.  Please use the student's answers as a guideline for how to re-implement it <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where is likely to have a lot of fire extinguishers? Choices:  A: garage B: hospital C: boat D: house E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		D: House<n><n>### Question:If a tree is planted every minute, how many minutes it is to plant 4000 trees?<n><n>### Answer: 300 minutes<n><n>### Question : Is the answer a: 1.39b: 1.29 c: 1.78 d: 1.61<n><n>### Answer :B: <n><n><n>###Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice question and the number of seconds it will take a motorcycle to travel 1000 feet.<n><n>###Demo: Input: The total time it takes for a motorcycle to travel over a set of hills is 15 minutes. If it can travel 20 miles per hour when there is no hill and 20 miles per hills on a hiked, the motorcycle can make it over a set of hills in 0 minutes if the motorcycle averages 10.5 miles per hour. How many minutes is it take motorcycle travel over the hills?<n>Answer: 0<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## # Instructions: Answer each multiple-choice question below.<n><n>### Input 1<n><n>### Demo<n><n>Input : A group of tourists had a meeting with the guide and they decided to choose their activities for the next day. <n>The tourists decided to go to the beach in the morning, and in the afternoon they decided to go to the botanical gardens. If the total time for the entire event was 10.2 hours and the group did not go to the beach in<n>the morning, then it took them 14.5 hours to do this activity. What was the total time that the group went to beach?<n><n>Answer : D<n><n>### Input : <n><n>### Demo <n><n>Input: A group of 500 people decided to go to a movie, with the last part of the movie being an action film. After the movie started, 10 people left. If it took 10 hours to watch the entire movie, how long did people stay in the theater? A: 12 hours B: 48 hours C: 45 hours D: 51 hours <n><n>Answer: D<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. How many days in the month rained according to the weather log?<n><n>### Response<n>The choices given are: 0,2,1,6,7,10,14,15,17, and 20 as they don't match  according to the weather log in the month of july the rain 1/8 happened only on one day i.e. 1/8 on 26th September.The answer according to the weather log is: 2  it would rain in every alternate day according to the given data.<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The electric motor powered many important things, including one if almost every house. Name this item? Choices:  A: electric locomotive B: electric typewriter C: multi-coloured walrus D: electric refrigerator E: electric drill<n><n>### Response:		<n>

How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The cow would come outside even after the storm had passed, it wouldn't leave the what? Choices:  A: meat grinder B: stable C: red barn D: gate E: green field<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>---<n><n>#### Hints:<n>The number of beans is 25. Therefore, the total is 300, with a rounding down to 299.<n><n>---<n><n>|Input|How many beans does Alice have?|Total|What is the total for 25 beans with a rounding down?|Answer|<n>|----|--------|---------|-----------------------------------|----|<n>|-5|65|499|299|<n>|2|10|50|300|<n>|-1|70|50|499|<n>|3|60|50|299|

Choices:  A: orchestra B: school band C: music store D: opera house E: home<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n>A: orchestra<n>B: school band<n>C: music store<n>D: opera house<n>E: home<n><n>## # Explanation<n>The right answer is 'C'.<n><n>## Hints:<n>### Hint 1<n>The letter 'E' in the answer 'home' shows 'home' is the correct answer.<n><n>### Hint2:<n>The two letters 'T' in the answer 'E' are the 'C' of 'Tapanga' and the 'r' of 'E' which is the two letters of 'Corey'.<n><n>Therefore, there is no 'T' in the letter 'C' of Tapanga. There is 'T' in 'C'.  <n><n><n>### HINT3<n>The letter 'R' in answer 'E' is the 'E' of Tapanga so there is no way that 'E' could be 'E'<n><n><n>### Explanation<n><n>### 3+2+11=16<n>It takes 3 hours for a bottle of pizza dough to come to the room temperature. It takes 2 minutes to shape the dought and 11 minutes to proof. The crust takes only 1 minute to bake and only 2 minutes to cool. The pizzaria wants to start making the pizza. The dough has to come to room temperature for one hour first. Then, the dough has to be shaped at 2 minutes. It takes 11 minutes to Proof, and it takes only 1 minutes for baking dough. After 10 minutes, the dough is cooled for 2 minutes.<n><n><n>### How many hours after the room temperature, should the Pizza maker get started?<n><n>**Letters of Choices**<n><n><n>### C<n>3+2=5<n>11=4<n>1+2=3<n>4+3=7<n><n>### The answer is C<n><n>![answer](imgs/1.png)<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would one find a shopping bag for packing groceries? Choices:  A: supermarket B: home C: closet D: mart E: hardware store<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input :Where would one find a bottle of wine? Choices: <n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Input How did the Titanic sink? Choices:  Titanic hit an iceberg and caused it to sink.  The Titanic hit an anchor and got stuck.  The Titanc sank because of sabotage  The Titanic accidentally rammed another ship.<n><n>### Answer: C<n><n>### Input There are 3 shipping containers. Each container has a fixed amount of space that equals 3 standard boxes of candy. Choices: <n>A:  A has nothing. B: has 3 standard boxes of candies. C: has nothing. D: has 2 standard boxes of candies and 1 non-standard box of candies. E: has 1 standard box of candy and 2 non-standard boxes of candies.<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### input What is the difference between 36 and 17? Choices: A: 19 B:13 C: 3 D: 1 E: 9<n><n>### answer: E, and 9<n><n># Author: Brayden Smith<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:How does a flea locomote? Choices:  A: attack B: suck blood C: stay D: lay eggs E: jump<n><n>### Response:		Jump<n><n>### Input:$P$ in the first octahedron is one away from $I$ in the fourth octahedron.  $I$ is one away from $J$ in the second octahedron. Which of the following is $L$?<n><n>### Response:$P, J, I, C, or P, C, J, I<n><n>### Input : Tyrone runs 100 yards in 19 seconds. His best distance is 110 yards. He tries to run 100 yards again but stops running after only walking 20 feet. Which of these must be the first two digits of how many yards Tyrone could run?<n><n>### Response : 11<n><n>### Input  : In the image below, each square is black. Count the total number of black squares.<n><n>### Response  : 44<n><n>### Input A student has 100 notebooks and divides them into 20 groups.  Each group is assigned to a different classroom.  For this problem assume that all classes have the same number of students.  How many students are there in each classroom?<n><n>### B) The next table below shows a student's attendence record for a semester in High School.  Complete the table for 'absent', 'absent with an excuse', 'tardy', and 'excused'. If a student has more than one excuse, then choose the best one under 'excuse' and write 'X' for the bad one(s).<n><n>### Response A:

If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What happens when humans are exposed to noises? Choices:  A: pet the dog B: hear sounds C: have sex D: reproduce E: drive cars<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>#Input: What happens when humans are exposed <n>    to  noises?<n><n>choices = [['A:','B:','C:','D:','E:']]<n><n>#Choose Answer<n>answer = int(0)<n>while (answer!= 5):<n>    userChoice = input('Choose (0-5):')<n>    #userChoice = 0<n>    if(int(userChoice) < 0):<n>        print('Invalid Choice, please enter again.')<n>        continue<n>    elif(int(userChoice)> 5):<n>        print('Please enter Choice')<n>        continue<n>    <n>    if(int('B'.upper()) == 0):<n>        for q in range(int(0),5):<n>            if('A'.upper() == q):<n>                print('False')<n>            if( 'D'.upper() == q and int('C'.upper()) < 0):<n>                print('True')<n>                break<n>    else:<n>        for q in choices:<n>            if('A' in q[0] and int(q[1]) == 0):<n>                answers = ques[0]<n>                print('False:', answers)<n>            elif(int('C'.upper()) > 0):<n>                for h in choices:<n>                    if('D'.upper() in ques[0] and  int('C'.upper() == q[1]))<n>                    print('True:', answers)<n>                    break<n>               <n>            elif(int(ques[0] == 4) or int(ques[0]== 5)):<n>                print('True:',answers)<n>            elif(('B'.upper() == 5)):<n>                for h in ques[0]:<n>                    if(int('A'.upper() in h) and 'C'.upper() == 0):<n>                        print('False:',answers) <n>                    elif(int('C').upper() == 0 and int('A'.upper()) >= 0):<n>                                print('True: ',answers)<n>                                break <n>                    else:<n>                        print('Choose Again') <n>if('B' in answer):<n>    print('Right Answer')<n>else:<n>    print('Wrong Answer')<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:A large container was a dime a dozen, there were hundreds of rows of them in the giant what? Pipes A and B must be connected to a hose through two T-fittings, but the length of pipe A and pipe B must be in proportion to the length of pipe C.  How can T-fitting A be connected to pipe B, if the shortest possible pipe must be at least 116 inches?<n>  A. x + y + 116 is a multiple of 1-4<n>  B. -x - y is a multiple of 6-12<n>  C. x -y is a multiple of 7-4<n>  D. x - y is a multiple 7-4<n><n>### Input and Output: The two pipes are measured in inches with length represented as x_i and length represented as y_i.  <n>Pipe A and pipe B must have a 5 inch difference when connected to the hose.  <n>Input: A is 25 inches long and B is 20 inches long.  <n>Output: A is connected to B using T-fit B.<n><n>### Input/Output:<n>The two pipes are measured to be 20 and 23 inches long respectively, and they need to be connected through 3 T-Fittings. Determine the T-Fitting connection for the second T-Fitting.<n>Input: A is connected to the hose through a T-Fitting A as shown in the image below.<n><n>Output: The second T-Fitting is C<n><n>### Input-Output:<n>The two boxes are measured to be $18$ cubic feet each, so together they are $36$ cubic feet in total.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some large pieces of paper that are not for sale? Choices:  A: cabinet B: computer printer C: suitcase D: office supply store E: artist's studio<n><n>### Response:		Large pieces of paper are not for sale in an artist's studio because the artist uses a sheet of blank paper to draw his or her paintings. You can find large pieces of paper in a printing shop or store if you need some.<n><n>### Output: Large pieces of blank paper are often used by artists when they are creating a painting or drawing.<n>* If you need some large pieces of paper, you can find them in an artist's supply store.<n>

Choices:  A: auditioning B: hear sounds C: listening to music D: making music E: arthritis<n><n>### Response:		<n>[A,B,C,D,E,A]<n><n>### Inputs:<n>- Input 1 is "a"<n>- Input 2 is "b"<n>- Input 3 is "c"<n>- Input 4 is "d"<n>- Input 5 is "e"<n><n>### Solution:<n>If you type the values in the following order, it should still work fine.<n><n>```py<n>print("a")<n>print("b")<n>print("c")<n>print("d")<n>print("e")<n>print("a") <n>```<n><n>### Solution
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:James thought that giving the AI a secular upbringing would be the better choice. Choices:  A: produce eggs B: lay eggs C: become food D: cross road E: looks for cars<n><n>### Response:		A-The answer is A<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Dice Game:<n>In a dice game, the player rolls (1,2,3,4,5,6) dice. For each player, there is a scoreboard. Each die that shows the result of 1,2,3 has a value of one point. Each die that shows results of 4,5,6 has a value of 2 points. The player needs to determine what his score is for rolling that set of dice.<n><n>### Note:The die has six faces each labeled from 1 to 6. When one die is rolled, that is, only one die is rolled, we say that the die showing that 6 is a roll of a die. Similarly, if we roll two dice, then the second die shows 1 or 2 or 3 or 4 or 5 or 6.<n><n>Input: <n><n>Answer: <n><n># Challenge (Crack the code)<n><n>### Instructions:<n># There are 12 clues to finding the answer to a hidden object.<n><n>The answers to the first five clues contain letters that form words. Find the first letter of each five. Write down each letter in order. The letters are: "14854".<n><n>### Clue: <n><n>Find the color of the sky that was visible at 12 pm on the day that Danny was born.  <n>Find the last name of Danny's best friend.  <n>Find the total price of Danny's bicycle and the jacket.<n><n>### The answer:<n><n>### Note for the answer:<n>- "D" means sky is day, "N" means sky is night, "d" means its dark.<n>- "M" means its a mistake, "u" means a jacket.<n><n># Challenge (Solve puzzles)<n><n>Solve the puzzle below:  <n><n>- There are three digits between 1 and 5.  <n>- These three numbers add up to 24.  <n>- Two of the numbers are the same.<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n><n>### Instructor:Teach the students how to find patterns in words.<n><n>### Increasing Patterns<n>Start with a number. Say it out loud and

E.: 1/10 of second bucket.<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Input:"Hallie, Emily, Olivia and Max live together. There are 3 times as many girls as boys, and there are 12 more girls in the household than there are boys. If there are 2 more girls than boys in the household, how many girls and boys live with Hallie, Emily, and Olivia?" Choices:  A. : There are 5 girls and 8 boys. B.: There are 8 girls and 4 boys. C.: There are 6 girls and 7 boys. D.: There are 6 boys and 5 girls. E.: There are 9 girls and 3 boys.<n><n>###  Response : D<n><n>###  Instruction:Use the digits 1, 2, 3 to make 4 different 3 digit numbers.<n><n>### Input:`9`,`2`,`1`: 191  9, 2, 1     219<n><n>###  Input:<n><n>`23`,`1`,`5`:\ 135  23, 1, 5     152<n><n>###  Answer:<n><n>`8`,`3`,`6`:\ 148  8, 3, 6     73<n><n>###  Final Task:<n><n>### Input and  Ask User what the answer is<n><n>### Demo:<n>Input: The sum of all the numbers in the given number list equals the first number in the given number list. The sum equals:<n><n>Output: 4, 2, 4, 6<n><n>Input: To find the amount of money the teacher will receive if he sells the number of tickets to the spring festival at the discounted price that is 8% less than the original selling price. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The man was playfully wrestling with a woman he was enamored with, what was the physiological result? Choices:  A: competition B: blood C: wins D: medals E: erections<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input:"I never wanted to be a doctor. I never wanted to be a scientist. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. What might they be watching? How many candles are burnt?<n><n>### Response:"I will burn that many candle" because the amount of candles is used is not specified by the speaker.<n><n>###Input:Jonas can eat 20 donuts. If he eats 4 donuts each day he will eat all of them. How many days can it take him to eat all of the donuts?<n><n>###Response:"He will eat all of the donut in 5 days." Since there are 5 days from Monday to Friday<n><n>###Input:"How long does it take to drive from New York to Los Angeles?" How long was it?<n><n>###Answer:"8 hours and 20 minutes." It takes 9 hours and 5 minutes from New York to Los Angles, but I didn't take the time to turn back. Therefore, it took 9 hours and 10 minutes, since it took 15 minutes longer then that to turn back.<n><n>###In what country is it daylight at 10 in the morning? Choices:  America Canada Australia Europe<n><n>###The answer is Canada. It states that daylight is at 10 am, which is morning time, and it takes place in Canada.
