He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:At a state fair judging pigs requires careful what? Choices:  A: verdict B: judging C: responsibility D: evaluating E: prejudice<n><n>### Response:		D. evaluation<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The lady was doing a one man show of her tell story, when the show began she did what? Choices:  A: persuade B: slept C: take center stage D: challenge E: speak clearly<n><n>### Response:		<n>* You have given me the correct information and I am able to see the answer.<n><n>### Input<n>: The doctor is always early to work and never late. However sometimes he is running and doesn't know where he is going due to being too tired. He may end up 20 streets away from where he is staying. On Wednesday, how many streets from where he currently is sleeping, will the doctor get lost?<n><n>Input: Bubbles the cat is hungry and wants a bite to eat. His owner, Alice, feeds Bubbles when he has a full stomach and he eats a fourth of his stomach capacity. Alice feeds Bubbles two-fourths of his stomach space. Now Bubbles looks at his stomach and eats a half of his stomach volume and he doesn't receive another full meal that day from his owner. <n>How did Bubbles's stomach look when he was not eating?<n><n><n>### Response Format for Writing a Task:<n>This task has been written to evaluate your understanding on how to write a multiple choice question (MCQ).<n><n>The key to understanding a multiple choice question is to always pay attention to the format.<n><n>Let's learn how to write a task in different formats that you can get in your assessment:<n><n>* Write a Task as a Multiple Choice Question<n>* Write a Task in a Fill in The Blank Format<n>* Write a Task where you can Write Your Own Answer<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would you store a shopping bag if all the seats in your vehicle are full? Choices:  A: the roof B: storage cabinet C: car trunk D: retail store E: home<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A: the roof<n><n>Because the bags would only take up room in the vehicle that cannot be used for passengers, the storage cabinet may be the most logical option.<n><n>#### B: storage cabinet<n><n>Because the storage cabinet takes up room in the vehicle it could only occupy where passengers could be sitting.<n><n>#### C: car trunk<n><n>Shopping bags could possibly be stored in the vehicle trunk because there is less room available compared to the storage cabinet for the passengers.<n><n>#### D: retail store<n><n>It is unreasonable to store bags in retail stores without a delivery worker.<n><n>#### E: home<n><n>Retail store clerks should not bring groceries home to save money for storage in the home.<n><n>### Response<n>How has this assignment improved your problem-solving ability?<n><n>> It hasn't given me much of a problem solving ability. While it was a good study, it didn't go as planned.

I pick 6 plates for one meal and I pick 12 plates for two other meals. I have 11 plates left over from the first meal, a third of the first meal. I also have 5 plates  left over from each meal. How many of those are left over?<n><n>### A<n>9<n>### B<n>6<n>### C<n>5<n>### D<n>10<n>### E<n>11<n><n>### Answer:<n>## Input<n>I pick 6 plates...<n><n>### Instuctin:<n>Subtracit 6 from 36<n><n>##Input<n>I have 18 from the meal<n>subtract A from A<n><n>Answer:<n>##Instructiuon:

How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature. It doesn't have a question mark and the answer is not correct.<n>\begin{itemize}<n>\item The answer should be in lowercase, as in the other multiple choice questions.<n>\item There is no such thing as "refrigerated dough" in English, so please remove it.<n>\item The entire first clause is wrong in English. The whole question is about baking. It should be phrased as: "The bakery opens at a.m. What is the latest time the baker can get to the bakery to start the jobs?<n>\end{itemize}<n><n>For the problem with the "refrigerated dough", I suggest just asking:<n><n>\begin{blockquote}<n>If the bakery opens 12 pm, what is the latest the head baker can get to bake the bread?<n>\end{blockquote}<n><n>And then later:<n><n>\begin*{blockquote}<n>You can't get the dough to bake until it's room temperature<n>\end{blockquote}\<n><n>Comment: Thanks for the note. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:We do not have rest, so how are we feeling? Choices:  A: exhausted B: lonely C: worked all day D: were very tired E: feel better<n><n>### Response:		I feel better<n><n>## Instruction:Select the right one on the option below<n><n>### Input;Today we visited the caves that are in the museum.We paid $10 for a tour, but we also paid an extra $15 for an audio guide device.After paying, we were in a line to pay admission and enter the caves.How many people were in front of us in line?<n><n>### Response;The answer is 10<n><n>## Instruction;Select the right answer on the following option<n><n>### Input ;How can you determine the total amount of money in a bank account?<n><n>### Answer;Counting the money<n><n>### Instructions:In the table below, answer the question based on the given input values. And "Strong 2" means that if this watch costs $10, 8 times that price will be $100, so the price of Strong 2 is $100. <br>  It should be $100 because if the price is $90, then $90 is 8 times more expensive and the total price is $90*8=$720. <br> <br>  So, $720 should be the price of Strong2.</p><n><n><n><n><n>[14-33 Coding Skills: Complete 30 Tasks Instructions](../15_solution_readings/14-34-coding-skills-complete-30-tasks-instructions.md)

Choices:  A: pocket B: office supply store C: friend's house D: desk drawer E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		The pocket<n><n>### Justification: Pockets are commonly found in shirts, dresses, backpacks, jeans and more. They make for easy storage of a pen, as they come in a variety of sizes and are a common clothing fixture. In addition, using pockets ensures the pen is stored in a convenient location, as opposed to, for example, a desk drawer or a city hall where one may not always have easy and frequent access to a pen.<n><n>### Input Question Choices: A: pocket B: notebook C: desk D: classmates E: teacher<n><n>### Response Question Choices: A B E D C<n><n>### Justifiction: A pen is a writing implement, so it would be stored in a notebook, desk, or teacher.<n><n>### How many people in your classroom are there?<n><n>Write the letter of the correct response in the space provided.<n><n>[![Code of Conduct](https://img.shields.io/badge/code%20of-conduct-blue.svg)](https://github.com/TechtonUH/Code_of_Conduct/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)<n>

Choices:  A: cattle ranch B: countryside C: grocery store D: slaughterhouse E: dairy farm<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>

It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What could someone be doing while performing that cannot be enjoyed by deaf people? Choices:  A: smile B: singing C: sweat D: act E: dance<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. On Friday, it goes to 12:00 pm. What time is it Friday, when it is Thursday?<n><n>Answer: 3pm<n><n>Input: Ali can cook either a pizza or a meatloaf each week. He likes both pizzas and meatloaf, but not both on the same night. How many weeks can Ali cook each before he cooks the same food as one of the previous weeks?<n><n>Answer: He must cook each one exactly 4 weeks apart. <n><n>Input: How many sides of an octagon have three equal angles?<n><n>Answer: Two<n><n>Input: What is the product of 2 squared, 3 squared and 4 squared?<n><n>Answer: \(256\)<n><n>Input: John's dog has a baby named Rex after John's father, who was a vet. Who do you think Rex is named after?<n><n>Answer: Rex is named after John's father. <n><n>Input; The number 636 is called ____________________.<n><n>Answer: A multiple of ten, a multiple of six, and a sum of three other numbers.<n>---<n><n><n>### Instructor: What are the six different ways to represent decimals? (Any of the above answers would qualify)<n><n>### Response...<n><n>#### Correct 100%:<n>The number 7 and 8% are both parts of 9.<n>---<n><n>\(57\) is __________________ than 1753648%.<n><n>A.  One hundred and seventy-five thousand, three hundred and sixty-five less than

Some of them speak English and others speak French. We use the left side of the road as it's safer.<n><n>### Response :All the inhabitants of my country are friendly, and some of them speak English. But we use the right side of the road as left-hand driving is safer.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>You are supposed to respond to the following statements.<n><n>### Examples:<n>1.In this task, there are 311 apples in total. In my country, the apples are friendly and some of them speak Greek.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>There are 311 fruits speaking Greek in my country. <n><n>1.My country's inhabitants are friendly. Everyone speaks Spanish except few.<n><n>### conclusion 1 :<n>Everyone speaking Spanish but Spanish speaking population are few in number. <n><n>### Task:<n><n>### Instructed:<n>There are three types of books: novels which are large and long, magazines, which are short, and comic books, which are only made of pictures. You can use a novel to read anything you want, but a magazine must contain text and pictures in order to be considered a magazine, and comic books are only about pictures and adventures.<n><n>### Direction:<n>Write a sentence for each of the following categories; novels, magazines, and comic books.<n><n>### Example:<n>Novels are long and thick book.<n><n>### Comparison:<n>The size of a book is proportional to the length of a book.<n><n>## Expected Outcome:<n>The number of sentences increases proportionally with respect to the number of the input.

My phone broke.<n><n>One sentence has incorrect punctuation because it is missing the ending "."<n><n>One sentence has multiple errors.<n><n>One sentence is a run-on sentence because it lacks a conjunction.<n>

Choices:  A: planet B: basin C: submarines D: earth E: pacific<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Explanation:The ocean forms the largest part of the earth's surface, and covers approximately 71% of its area. It is generally divided into an ocean of saltwater known as the World Ocean (sometimes referred to as the "global ocean"), and other, mostly smaller, bodies of salt water that are partly surrounded by land. This division is artificial, because many bodies of water are connected to others by one or more of the world's waterways, and the ocean is believed to be a single entity because of the interconnected salinity, temperature, currents, chemistry, biology and other properties of the bodies of water grouped as the ocean. In other words, the ocean is generally taken to constitute the body of saline water (as opposed to freshwater) that appears in the globe's outline (i.e. from the shore).<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>* Input: Which of the following has the greatest surface area? Choices: A: earth B: moon C: sun D: Mars E: Jupiter<n><n>### Response : C<n><n>### Explanaition:The Sun's surface diameter is about 1,392,684 km (865,716 mi) (over nine times the diameter of the Earth), and it has an equatorial radius of about 695,500 km (432,000 mi), which is a little over 109 times the Earth's radius and just over one-11th the average distance between the Sun and the Earth (about 150 million km (93 million mi)).

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Rumors of roving bands of monsters killing people could lead to what? Choices:  A: panic B: getting in trouble C: mass hysteria D: go to prison E: murder<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input:[3 apples or 2 bananas?](https://www.dropbox.com/s/jw3176i8p6ey3uq/Apples_Banana.jpg?dl=0)<n><n>### Response:[4 bananas or 6 apples?](https://www.educationsystem.net/uploads/media/images/118828-21679999489461.jpeg)<n><n>### Input:"Freddy is calling his family." Which sentence best completes this?<n><n>### Response:"Local calls cost 5 c. per minutes."<n><n>### Instructions:[Molly and Dale put pencil sharpeners on the fridge. Molly puts a sharpener on top of the left cabinet, while Dale puts a sharpener in the middle of the cabinet on the right. How many sharpener do they have altogether?](https://www.khanacademy.org/test-prep/sat/sat-math/a/sat-slo-practice/x/sat-practice-dont-know-what-the-sharpeners-are)<n><n>### Instructer:Answer the above question but with only pictures.<n><n>### Input:(3 apples or 1 banana?<n><n>### Input:@"Freddy is calling..."<n><n>### Insturction:Answer the above question again (pictures only) but using colors instead of words.<n><n>### Response:(Pink: Local, Green: International)<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>As we can see the students of grade 4 did not use any of the information. This is because as a language is being developed it needs to be more precise with the information they give. If we were to do all the instruction this way by only providing pictures with no language, the students would never be able to develop a language. This is an exercise that is to teach them how to give instructions to others by using a language instead of hand-drawings.

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The mother was worried about all the spills, so she bought a rug for under the what? Choices:  A: persia B: table C: living room D: house E: desk<n><n>### Response:		The only correct one is - A - Persian rug<n><n><n>### Instructions<n>This problem may require multiple steps.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: There are six candies: Five each of red apples and white apples and three each of green apples.<n>What type of apple has the fewest?<n><n>### Dem<n>What type of apple does NOT have the many?<n><n>### Response<n>This problem may require one or more operations.<n><n>### Response Input<n>One of the candies is a red apple. The rest of the candies are white apples.<n><n>### Solution Input<n>The candy that does not have the many candies is green apple.<n><n>### Outcome<n>The outcome is green apples.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What will all the differences equal? Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice A: sum<n><n>### Input<n>1. 58 + 44 = 102<n>2. 85 - 60 = 25<n>3. 50 - (-14) = 64<n><n>### Response<n>Choice C: alike<n><n>### Input 1:<n>2 + 4 = 6<n>4 / 2 = 2<n><n>## 25<n>### Instruction 1:<n>Input: Find a new hobby.<n>Answer: Play soccer<n><n>### Instructions 2:<n>Input: You are an elite scientist and your next goal is to invent a bionic dog.<n>Answer: You invent a robotic dog to help the police find criminals<n><n>### Instructio 3:<n>Input: One morning, Mandy is watching TV. She has been awake for 2 hours and 27 minutes. Her phone rings and she stays on the phone for 30 minutes. How long has Mandy been watching TV in total?<n>Answer: 4 hours and 32 minutes<n><n>### Instruption 4:<n>Input: You had $20 to spend at a carnival. You spend $14 on hot dogs, $5 on popcorn, $5 on cotton candy,  and $5 on drinks. How much money did you have left to spend?<n>Answer: $2

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature. What was the room temperature as the housewife went to the kitchen?<n><n>Room temperature: 54 degrees F<n><n>### Output show 2006 is an even number:2006 is not an even number. That is because 2 is 1.412539273725681 in decimal form.<n><n>### Output the following equation by following steps:685+9-84/10=___<n><n>685 + 9 - 84/10 = 685 + 84 / 10 = 769<n><n>### Output that the sum of the integers is shown above: Choices: A: 3, B: 6, C: 9, D: 18, E: 15, F: 15, G: 38<n>#### Output:3+6+9+15+38=___<n><n>3 + 6 + 9 + 15 + 38 = 80<n><n>#### Explanations to the following problems:<n>##### 1:<n>##### 2:<n><n>##### 3:<n>##### 4:<n>##### 5:<n>##### 6:<n>##### 7:<n>##### 8:<n>##### 9:<n>##### 0:<n><n>

The price of the material and equipment.<n><n>A man can decide to paint only if he can afford the material and equipment needed to make the painted job complete. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What does exercising immediately lead to? Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		<n>  - Exercise immediately causes you to become stronger.<n>- <n>### Input:How are exercise and relaxation the same? Choices: <n>A: You can exercise or relax any time of the day.<n><n>B: Once a person has a good workout, it is easier to relax.<n><n>C: Both exercising and relaxing will help a person sleep better.<n><n>D: It is easy for a person to fall asleep after exercise.<n><n><n>### Response A: <n>- B and C are both the same<n>

Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The wood became fossilized, what did the paleontologists call it when they found ti? When all 9 boards are complete there are 648 possible hands. The probability of there being no pair of the same team playing alone on the same board for 12 hands is 2^648/2^9 =  1/336. This gives the probability of there being paired playing alone for at least one hand - p =  2^640/2^9 = 7,292,000,000/336 or, alternatively, 20.5%.<n><n>### Input n 12 20 28 18 26 <n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input    7007342783 7724071395 8004075321 7222273235<n><n>### Response A B D<n><n>### Input          8994950334 9997055603 7769889714 7324504977<n><n>### Response B A C<n><n>### Question 6:<n><n>Input: Alice and Bob are both making pizzas. Each time Alice finishes a pizza, Bob will cut it and leave the box half empty (but will never cut a pizza Alice has not yet completed). When Bob is done, Alice will cut his remaining pizzas in half and put his pizzas in the freezer. After that Alice will take some frozen pizza boxes to cook and Bob will take the rest of the pizza boxes out of the freezer. If Bob starts cooking as soon as Alice puts his pizzas in Bob's freezer, how much time will pass until Alice puts Bob's last pizza in her freezer?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>If Alice has finished a pizza, Bob is the only one who can cut it. The order Alice cuts Bob's pizzas will affect how many pizzas Alice can add to her freezer. If Alice cut

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where in Southern Europe would you find many canals? We can use an if statement to tell the computer to count each number, text, or whole word.<n>```<n>function count(input, type){...}<n>function is_whole_word_count(word, string){...}<n>function sum(string){...}<n>```<n><n>`Sum(sum(count(if (is_whole_word "word" is_whole_tower, 1, 0))))`<n><n>#### B:<n>Sometimes, You have to count how many of something, like every whole number in a big list of digits, You can do that by making a function that counts the amount of something, like whole numbers, and putting that into the input, like in this image, where the function is in the computer, and the input is every number.<n><n><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l2S8YsVJtEJkQ5g4D/giphy.gif"><n><n>When you tell the function to count like this, it takes every digit as a whole number, the computer will then start asking, "Is there any whole number here?" If the computer says yes, it will start to count how much of that type there is.<n><n>```<n>function how_many_whole_num(){}<n>```<n><n>#### C:<n>When the input is a picture, and you know exactly what you need to count, like the colors. For example, if you wanted to get the colors and then you know what they are.

The gate doesn’t close until the car moves passed it and goes away from the light.

He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? Choices:  A: get smart B: boredom C: colds and flu D: taking tests E: spend time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>[![Blog Post #2](https://github.com/EliRubin16/blog_post_project/blob/main/Instructions_and_Response.gif)](https://github.com/:EliRubin6259468741/tree/main/blog_post_and_response)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would you see people in uniform playing with a ball? Choices:  A: hole B: television C: sporting goods store D: pool table E: sporting event<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>(a) A<n><n>(b) D<n><n>(c) C<n><n>(d) B<n><n>(e) I<n><n>### Input<n>There is a line of people waiting in a super-long line at the local diner. In what order should a child and two adult tickets be issued to allow the child and adults to take up a table with the smallest amount of movement?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Child(smallest), adult (second smallest), adult (second largest)<n><n>### Exercise:<n>If a boy's bike is faster than her sisters bike by 20 seconds and her sister's bike is twice as fast as that of her father, how long does it take them if they leave together from the same point?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n>The total travel time taken by them is : (49600 + 7200) seconds that is, 56800 seconds<n><n>### Exploration:<n>Let Bike A be fastest to reach, that is, Bike A has speed's'.<n>Now Bike B, being two times faster of that of B, will take 2 times the time taken by A : that is, Bike  B will take 2 times ( s / 2) seconds to reach the point<n>Now Bike  C, being 3 times the speed of B, will take ( 3 * s / 2 ) seconds to travel.<n>So A will take 1 more second than Bike C to travel. <n>Now 4 times the speed of Bike  C is the speed of B.<n>So the total time taken by them to travel from the start to the point together is: <n>( s + ( 3 * s )) seconds<n><n>### Example:<n><n>Bike A  takes 1 hour to arrive at the starting point from<n><n>Bike B and C take 1 more hour to complete the journey<n><n>So all bikes take more than 2 hours to travel to the given destination<n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: empathy B: anxiety C: knowlege D: falling down E: hear things<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input :The teacher told all the student that listening was key, as it was the ___________ way in which they would gain _________.  Choices A: easiest, anxiety   B: main, knowledge   C: second, hearing D: hardest, empathy E: best, falling down  [Above I did not capitalize because that means it is a response and the next response is the response that goes with the question but in a comment I do capitalize if I respond]<n><n>### Response :C<n>

What time is it when he stops for the night?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Time: 9:45 PM<n><n>Time: 9 AM<n><n>Time: 3PM<n><n>Time: 5:30PM<n><n>Time:8PM<n><n>Time:10PM<n><n>Time : Midnight<n><n>Time: 2AM<n><n>Time: 4 AM<n><n>Time:6 AM<n><n>Time:8 AM<n><n>### Response <n><n>At this point, the man should stop on the way to the next rest stop. Choices:  A: person B: species C: artichoke D: all mammals E: live animal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Certainly humans will, the way A,B,C and D are given in the options, there can be no mammals which were not born in a manner that shows compassion. No animal is born inherently cruel either. Many wild animals are caring. It is human beings who lack compassion by default. Humans only feel and show compassion when they are taught it. Choices:  A: box B: home C: alley D: lap E: barn<n><n>### Response:		A: box<n><n>Input:Which one is longer, 260 hours or 500 minutes?<n><n>Input:Whose name comes after "Derek, Michael, Kevin, and Brian"?<n><n>Input:How many hours are in 4 days?<n><n>Input:How much money does Mica have?Mica spent $60 on a box of macaroons. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where would someone learn to play an upright piano? Choices:  A: music room B: music store C: music class D: medium E: house<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>There are 12 sheep living on the farm. 3 sheep run away and 5 new sheep join the farm.  If a farmer kills 5 sheep to make sausage, how many sheep are there on the farm?<n><n>### Response<n>A<n><n>### Input <n>Daisy's room is 45% larger than her brother's room. If each room uses the 10th of 2 gallons of water for each room, how many gallons were used in all for the total space?<n><n>### Answer E<n><n>### Input :<n>If you put a cup in a cup that has more liquid in it than the top cup, the top cup will overflow because there is more room for liquid than there is in the top cup.<n><n>### Response :<n>A

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Who is likely going in to a market? Choices:  A: stress B: food C: that you D: spending money E: walking<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:(For children ages 1-10):  Find the missing numbers in the pattern <n><n>### Response:(For children ages 7-8): 3, 5, 7, 9 7, 9, <n><n>### Input :(for students in grade 6): The perimeter of a small rectangle is<n><n>### Response :(for students in grade2): 92, 112, 132, 152<n><n>### Instructions:(For children ages 2-3): There are ten apples.  Each person eats five.  How many apples are left?  Choose all that apply: A: two B: four C: six D: eight E: ten E: ten<n><n>### Instructios:<n><n>### Demmonstration:<n><n>### Input : What's your favorite animal?<n><n>### Response : tigers<n><n><n>### Input  : What's your pet's favorite food?<n><n>### Respone  : pizza<n><n><n>### Instuments  : What's the difference between 18 and 19?<n><n>### Demomstraction  : 1<n><n>### Instrument : What's the distance between two of the stars?<n><n>### Demention : 1<n><n><n>### A : What's the greatest number that is less than a  a<n><n>### A  : 999<n>### <n><n>### B  : what's your favorite color?<n>### <n>### B :  red<n><n>### C  : What does your mom like to do?<n>### C : bake<n><n>### D : What does your dad like to eat?<n>### D : chicken <n>### E  : I get A+ B+ C+, so what do I have?<n>### A<n><n><n><n><n>### Q : What does zero + 400 = ____?<n><n>### A: Zero + 400 will be 400<n><n>### Q: What does 13 + 16 = 29?<n><n>## Demooimation : 1<n><n># The First question in the test.<n>###

If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:How can one's views change after learning about science? Choices:  A: appreciation of nature B: become educated C: excitement D: increased knowledge E: see things differently<n><n>### Response:		Option C:Excited<n><n>### Instructions:Please answer the following question. Be sure to read and follow our [Contest Rules](https://www.wired.com/2014/12/rules).<n><n>### Instruct:<n>Write a response that, in your opinion, is the best of these answers.<n><n>Answer 1: "An increase in knowledge can only lead to an increase in appreciation and excitement. The process is circular, and never ending."<n><n>Answer 2: "When we are exposed to new ways of thinking, our worlds become a little brighter and broader. Our ideas become more flexible. We become more accepting of what we never knew existed as real."<n><n>Answer 3: "It all boils down to the fact that, no matter who we are and what we do for a living, everyone is a human and it’s easy for a human to learn that there is no end to knowledge."<n><n>Answer 4: "Every time I learn about something new, my horizon expands, and I am able to see more than I could see before. I begin to view things from different angles, and I begin to notice previously obscured details. Most importantly, I am able to realize the vastness of what I don’t know, and I become passionate about finding answers to those questions, and seeking out new knowledge."<n><n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Demostration<n>[Asking Questions](http://www.wiredspeak.org/1217/)<n><n>### Instruitction:<n>Write a response  that makes a case that the previous statement is wrong.<n><n>### Option A:<n>"When exposed to new ways of perceiving the world, our minds become so saturated with information, there’s little room left for what we already know."<n><n>### Instuiton:<n>Write a response showing a logical falsity<n><n>### Option B:<n>"When new ideas emerge, it usually can only be because there were holes in an old paradigm."<n><n>### Option C:<n>"Knowledge cannot be infinite, by its very nature. No human brain - no matter how intelligent - could ever absorb all that exists. There are just too many things we don't know."<n><n>## Content/Acknowledg

A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What can someone feeling happiness fall into? Choices:  A: lead to laughter B: love C: laughter D: smiles E: tears<n><n>### Response:		C is a lead to laughter.<n><n>### Comment:The most common response was: "E is happiness." This was the choice I gave for "C." I gave this choice because "love" fits "smiles," "tears," and "C." You may have picked "C" because you think laughter can be caused by happiness, leading to the idea to pick "A," which is what I thought was the most correct answer.<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>What did you like about this challenge in general (e.g. the multiple choice question, the demo, the instructions and response, etc.)?<n>I think that the multiple choice questions helped me learn. The response should give a choice, and an explanation. If there is more choice options the response may give a second explanation. One of the responses should be C, and one should be D.<n><n>###  Input: I am the manager of several stores in different areas. I need to determine the store that needs the most work. Choices: (A) sales numbers, (B) customer reviews, (C) sales numbers and customer reviews, (D) product quality.<n><n>### Response #1:<n>Answers: C<n><n>Explanation: The store may need more sales which could be increased by customer reviews and the store also needs increased customer satisfaction.<n><n>### Expanded response<n>I have a store that has high sales, but lacks customer satisfaction. The store with high sales and customer satisfaction would probably be the most successful.<n><n>### Note:<n>Do not use all 3 choices. <n><n>###  Response #2:<n>Answers B.<n><n>Explanation D.<n><n><n><n><n>### Expansive<n><n>I would also think that a store may be good if it has the highest reviews, but maybe the lowest customer sales. This is because a person may like a certain company, so they are more likely to read a review, and not look at the sales.<n>

Choices:  A: communicating with others B: hurt feelings C: dry mouth D: intimacy E: changing behavior<n><n>### Response:		Your goal when talking to someone is a combination of your personalities, styles, and background. You also have the skills to express yourself fluently, or lack competence and confidence in communication. Knowledge about the topic is not the only thing needed to deliver a powerful presentation. It is also important to express your voice in the conversation by using facial expressions and gestures to support your message. A good presentation is organized and provides a clear structure about the information to be transmitted and the message needs to be relevant to the listener's context. Your presentation will be able to stand out in the room when your delivery is expressive and confident.<n><n>### Input:(See above) When working on a presentation, you realize that you are going to talk to your colleague as well as many other people from your company. The first step should always be to plan for audience interaction, which is part of the preparation and the strategy of any presentation. To engage more with your audience, you should use different delivery and speaking techniques; you should get involved in your presentation. Remember that one of the most common mistakes is simply using the same delivery technique for the whole audience. You should know it would be important to change the volume, the pace, the tonality, and facial expression throughout your presentation. It is always important to be aware of the type of venue you are speaking in to ensure you have a successful presentation.<n><n>### Include all the instruction<n><n>

If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where can peanut butter be stored? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:If done correctly grooming pet's nails generally does not cause this? Choices:  A: training B: satisfaction C: injury D: beauty E: late<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explanation:<n>

It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Eating breakfast in bed can make you feel what, assuming that you don't spill anything? Choices:  A: vomiting B: pleasure C: happiness D: contentment E: mess<n><n>### Response:		The right answer is C.  <n><n>### Input<n>Nalani and Diana are best friends and their dog is named Nugget. It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Blood isn't usually spilled during what sport that doesn't allow the use of hands? Choices:  A: soccer game B: capillaries C: ball D: animals E: person<n><n>### Response:		A, soccer game<n><n>### The answer was: The answer was:<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Sports where hands are used aren't often bloodletting situations. Boxing and even MMA (where even the fists are heavily protected by protective pads) and wrestling are sports in which hands are used, and are usually not bloodletting situations. However, those sports are also sports that end when  someone is no longer conscious. Sports where people aren't required to punch or kick each other (or even use their bodies in any significant way to affect the game) are rarely bloodletting situations. Tennis, hockey, and soccer aren't bloodletting sports. B is capillaries, which are microscopic tubes in our body that carry red blood cells, and, thus, blood. C is ball, which is almost certainly incorrect. D is animal, and so may be blood. E is person, which is the answer to the question.<n><n>## Bonus<n>### Instruction<n>Describe a situation where you made a mathematical error, and provide at least one lesson learned.<n><n>### Bonus Explanation:<n>I think everyone does this, but we all think we're doing it less than we are, and so we're in the game of lying to ourselves too much.<n><n>One time, I had a test, and I was like, cool, right, I'm going to ace this test! But I didn't. In fact, I bombed the test.<n>The best thing I could say is that I'm glad I did bomb the test, because then I could realize what I needed to learn, how to work harder, how to become better.<n><n>Now, I get B's and A's on tests. I'm still going to mess up sometimes, but not on big tests, not on finals, not on quizzes where failure is a big deal.<n><n>---

Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Many addicts turn to exercise to deal with their addictions, this is because it is a healthy way to do what? Choices:  A: condition heart B: expend energy C: laugh D: stretch E: weigh<n><n>### Response:		The correct statement is 'C', stretch<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: You have been offered an internship that requires you to work 60 hours of overtime per week. You would only have time to work on weekends once a week for 6 hours each day. What is your maximum wages per week? This is your weekly pay per hour worked minus the cost of your internet service per year.<n>Answer: 259<n><n>Input: A truck hauls gravel. Each load of gravel weighs 2 tons. How many meters of fence are needed to fence in a rectangular plot of land 11 meters long and 8 meters wide?<n>Answer: 70<n><n>Input: There’s a table with 8 seats and 12 children. There are no more seats at the table. How many children left the table?<n>Answer: 0<n><n>Input: How many liters of ice cream could fit in 2 liters of a container?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: A store sells 20% of its total stock in one week. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:A shop will give you what for your purchases? Choices:  A: downtown area B: container C: ocean floor D: the lost city of atlantis E: high school<n><n>### Response:		The lost city of Atlantis<n><n>### Instructions and Explanation:<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>The option E, the lost city of Atlantishas the most number of words 13. The next option is E, the lost city is on the ocean floor, which also has 13. The number of words in B, container, and D, the downtown area is 8. Thus 8 and 13 are the only two options that are correct.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n><n>Therefore we can say the loss city of Atlantis is the only and the only correct answer.

Where does he live? Choices:  A: fish market B: pet shop C: great outdoors D: river E: little mermaid<n><n>### Response:		In most circumstances, a blowfish is considered marine based because the majority of its natural habitat occurs in oceans. But if the blowfish is in captivity then it could be considered something other than marine.<n><n>### Input<n>  | Question | Answer |<n>:--|:-:|:-:|<n>  | The sum of two numbers is 64. The difference of two numbers is 2. What is the bigger of the two numbers?| _ 17 _|_ 46 _<n><n>### Solution<n>First we list the possibilities to compare(32,42) (10,34) (33,31) (11,33) So we eliminate everything not divisible by 2(10,34,11) then we subtract the possibilities that can not be the bigger number such as (33,32) so the bigger number is 46.<n>

Eight out of every 16 are lighted. Which three candles lighted are lighted?<n><n>### Output: <n>Candle 3, 5, and 11<n><n>### Instructions:Input: The 3-day-old baby wants to be up all night.
