If the 3 day old baby is awake for a part of each hour, When does it get fully awake? <n><n>### Input(n):<n>Input: There are (342667 - 7) giraffes in the herd. How many are female?<n>Output: (342650 - 7)<n><n>### Demos:<n>1. I add 1 to the input and I subtract 7 from the 342669, which means that the female giraffe counts are 342652 giraffes;<n>2. After I subtract, there is 1 giraffe that is female and 1 giraffe male, making a total of 342671<n><n>### Input<n>A box holds a half dozen donuts. The box weighs 5 pounds. How many pounds does the entire supply of donuts  weigh?<n>Input: A box holds a half dozen doughuts. The box weighed 5 pounds. How much does the entire supply of doughnuts weight together?

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Whether it's popped, grilled, or canned people like to what? Choices:  A: expect to die B: believe in god C: stay in D: watch movies E: eat corn<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>'A'<n>```<n>

How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. The output of the program must be printed to the screen.<n><n>### Exercise7.java<n>package exercise7;  <n>import java.util.Scanner;  <n>    public class Exercise7 <n><n>    {<n>        public static void main(String[] args) <n><n>        { <n>            int myAns, a = 0, b = 0, average = 0; <n>            float averageF = 0;<n>            Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);<n>            System.out.println("Enter the first number"); <n>            a = keyboard.nextInt(); <n>            System.out.println("Enter the second number"); <n>            b = keyboard.nextInt (); <n>            average = (int) (((a + b) / 2) );<n><n>            averageF = (int)(average / 2);<n>            System. out.println("The average is:  " + average);<n>            System. <n><n>            System.out   .println("The average using float is " + averageF );<n>        }<n>    }<n>#### Your Output Should Be :<n>Enter the first number<n>11<n>Enter the second number<n>21<n>The average is: 16.50000<n>The average using float is 16.18<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What is love when everyone keeps feeling it? Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. contagious B. wrong C. last forever D. painful E. blind<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: How many minutes are there in 45 hours?<n>Answer: 45<n>

Choices:  A: music store B: orchestra C: jazz band D: rock band E: music studio<n><n>### Response:		<n>The string quartet is typically made up of 2 violins, 1 viola, and 1 cello. However, there are many types of string quartets: a string quartet can be made up of violins, cellos, violas, basses, etc. For example, there are orchestras that only have viola strings.<n><n>Choices: A, B, C, D, and E<n><n>### Input 1:A bag contains 20 apples & 18 oranges. Call the question in index.html using [a link with HTML href](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_Types/anchor) to the HTML file.<n><n>The HTML file should show a prompt, followed by 4 possible choices, with a radio button to select each choice. Each choice should have a link to the next question HTML file. The link to the next question should start at: `http://localhost:8000/multiple_question/index.html`.<n><n>For example, a question saying, “A, B, or C?” would look like this:<n><n>![multiple_choice_prompt](../../img/homework/multiple_question/image10.png)<n><n>Clicking “A” goes somewhere else (for example, http://localhost:8020/). <n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Where is a monkey likely to be found in the rainforest? Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is: E - the zoo<n><n>### Input Tip<n><n>#### You will learn how to look at a question and use your knowledge to reason through what the question is asking. A common problem some students face is thinking they have found the solution only<n>to later realize they missed a key bit of information. <n><n>```<n>*The key bit of information is that the answer can be found by either asking "yes" or "no" questions. <n><n>*This means that there really is only one kind of question that we can ask for a multiple-choice question: either " yes" or "no".<n><n>```<n><n>### Problem Solving Practice<n><n>Input: Ali has 20 lizards. She donates half of them to the zoo, and then sells 3/4 of what's left. She's got a couple bucks left over. How many lizards does Ali start with?<n><n>1. Yes or No Question:<n><n>Is she started with 20 lizard? If yes, then answer: 20<n><n>2. Yes or No Question<n><n>Does she sold lizards? If yes, then answered: 16<n><n>3. Yes or No Question (Combination)<n><n>Is she started off with 20 lizard and she sold lizards?, She sold 3/4 lizard, does she have more or less lizard than when she started with 2 lizard? If less,then she would donated to the Zoo, then the answer is: 0<n><n>4. Yes or No Question <n><n>Does she donated lizard? If yes, then to which lizards did she donated? If she donated to every lizard, then the answer is 0. <n>She sold 3/4 her lizards, and donated to zoo, then 1/4 is still left, does she donate 1/4 of the 1/4? If she donated all the lizards, so she sold all the lizards. Then the answer is 0<n><n>5. Yes or No Question, Question (Combination), Question (Combination, and Question (Combination and Question)<n><n>Yes or No is: 5<n><n>Yes or Question (Combination): Does she have any lizard left? if yes
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:What does reckless driving lead to on a person? Choices:  A: injuries B: fatigue C: traffic jams D: tired E: accidents<n><n>### Response:		<n>This problem might be confusing, but the best way to solve this question is first look at the answer choices. We could notice all our answers will always include letters A-D. We know that this must have been a choice that was in our list so the option that was not included would be the answer.<n><n>The solution to this question would be answer: E - accidents.<n><n>### Input<n>Michael makes birdhouses to be sold at craft shows. He charged $5 for each large birdhouse. He charged $3 for each medium birdhouse and $2 for each small birdhouse. This week he sold 2 large birds house. He also sold 2 medium birdhousr. He sold 3 small birdhouse. How much money did he make this week in dollars?<n><n>### Response<n>This is a straightforward question.<n><n>Solution: 5+3x3 = 18 dollars. He was selling items and he made the profit that was on sale, so this is the answer on how much money he made.<n><n>#### Additional Solution<n><n><n><n>For a simpler solution we could also write it all in a basic equation.<n><n>$5(2) + $3(2) + $2(3) = $18$<n><n>### Input 1<n>Lloyd and his friends planned a secret trip to Mexico. They are each taking 3 bags. The flight is going to take 5 hours. How many hours will they be at the airport?<n><n>### response1<n>First, we should look at the wording to make sure we understand the question.<n><n>We look at the first sentence:<n><n>'Lloyd and his friends are each taking 3 Bags.'<n><n>We can tell from this that each bag is equal, so the equation will be a simple one.<n><n>However to solve the question we need to know how many hours the trip will be before we can complete the simple equation.<n><n>$3(\frac 5 8) + 3$<n><n>$\frac 13 + 3$<n>The correct answer is 2 hours.<n><n>### Solution 2<n><n>We could also solve the equation in the opposite way that would be in the opposite order.<n><n>1. 3x3x5 / (3x3+3x3x5)= 5hours<n><n>2. 15

Bella has four time as many apples as Ali and twice as many pears as Ali. How many apples does Ali have?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Ali has 65 apples.<n><n>### Input <n><n>Rita's sister's family has more children than Rita's. In total, Rita and her sister's family have 56 children, including Rita. Her sister has 3 children, Rita has 3 children and 3 grandchildren. For every child born in Rita's family, one child is born in her sister's family. If Rita has 4 grandchildren in her grandchildren's family and it takes 6 children in Rita's grandchildren's family to have another child in her grandchildren' s family, how many children are there in Rita's sister' s family including the 3 grandchilden? <n><n>### Response <n>Rita's husband and his sister together have a total of 3 more children than Rita.<n><n>### Question:<n>How can you combine 4 3s, a 6, and a 7 into a single number?<n><n>### Answer:<n>To combine 4 3's, a 6 and a 7 into one number, you can find the remainder of dividing each number by 4, the remainder divided by 6, and the remainder divided by 7. So, the answer is 447.<n><n>### Test 3 <n>How can you combine a 9, a 4, an 8, and a 9 into a single number? A 2, a 3 and a 5? A 3, a 2 and a 6? A 1, a 2 and an 8?  <n><n>### Answer 1:<n>The answer is to divide by 9 first, then by 4, then the remainder of dividing by 8. The remainder divided by 9, the remainder divided by a 3 and the remainder divided by a number is 0. So the answer is 30.<n><n>### Answer2:<n>What number comes right after 9? The numbers

If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The new kitten hadn't gotten used to what it was allowed to climb on in most rooms, so the owned kept the bedroom door what? Choices:  A: opened B: closed C: found at shower D: falling down E: locked<n><n>### Response:		Locked<n><n>A: open<n><n>B: closed<n><n>C: found at shower<n><n>D: fallling down<n><n>E: locked<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>```python<n>def solve():<n>  answer = ''<n>  command_string = 'input_string | command | response = None' # Create strings we will work with  <n>  command = 'A|B|C|D|E' # Values of 'A-' through 'E-'<n>  command_string += 'input:{} = response.upper() | response = lowerCase(response)'.format(command) # Convert response to lower case<n>  #command_string += 'if response.startswith('''a.|B|C|d.|E.'''):<n>  command_string+='import upperCase,lowerCase # Import uppercase() and lowercase()<n>  response=upperCase(response).lowerCase()'<n>  with open('Question.md', 'r') as file:<n>   for line in file:<n>     if line.startswith(command_string):<n>       if line.find('input:')!= -1 and line.find('.upperCase')!=-1:<n>         answer = upperCase(line)<n>         print(answer)<n><n>'''<n><n>solve()<n>```<n><n>

It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The disease was spreading fast, so what were researchers desperately seeking? Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input : 79.43<n><n>### Response :<n>2.2 <n>### Input:73.32<n><n>### Response:=123.83<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:He needed to check an electrical connection in the house, where did he look? If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Jan went to the auditorium and listened to the speech. Where might he be? Choices:  A: crowd B: high school C: city D: somewhere E: theater<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input:Jan went to the Auditorium and listened to Speeches.  He was right in middle of the crowd so it would be D.<n><n>### Input-<n><n>Input: Jan, the head baker of Le Pretentieux Bakery had a delivery and had to run to the store to get strawberry jam for the pies they are making, he also has to buy 10 chips for the employees at the bakery from the bakery to another store. He got to the bakery and it was 2 minutes to 9 and he had a meeting with an employee training client. He has 30 minutes. A: meet with employees B: get all the ingredients C: get all the ingridients to the bakery D: meet employee for training E: get the strawberries from the florist A: B: C: D: E:<n><n>### Response-<n><n>Input:<n>Jan has to go to the bakery. He has 3, 2, 1, and 0-90 seconds to get there he needs to get there before 10am to see employee but he has to be at the bakery before 9am to get what he has to get for the bakery. If he didn't meet with the employee or get everything he needed as soon as possible for the bakery he should go back and pick up everything and get the strawberrries and get them to the bakery which would take him more time for him to get to work on time.<n><n>### Credits-<n><n>Dominic Nguyen<n>-https://googledrive.com/host/0Bw3G98wY7r48YUxHYWdhcW5tV00/Math_Assignment_3_and_4_Instructions_and_Answers.pdf<n><n>Credits-<n><n>Adeline Thaiyapakan, Allyson Goto-Jones, Chloe Shiozawa, Daniel Shih, Grace Wu, Jennifer Nguyen, Jessy Vu, Jordan O'Callaghan, Lillie Nguyen, Mabel Lee, Michael Lui<n><n>-https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B0o623

Four: It is below 85 therefore it will not work.<n><n>**Choice:** "None."<n><n>### Output: Tapanga and corey had 66 candies and 29 candy. Which was greater?<n><n>Answer: "29 Candy"<n>

Choices:  A: workplace B: bus station C: social atmosphere D: neighbor's house E: at school<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is B.<n><n>### Input Two: How much do you buy a cake that costs $12.30 and it has a 10% discount? Choices:  A: jerusalem B: texas C: middle east D: china E: india<n><n>### Response:		<n>I am very good in math. I've taken a ton of math classes already. I believe I've learned the skills necessary to get a good grade in this math class. I just need some experience with the kind of work this college level math class is going to give me. I love to exercise and do math challenges with my friends because I like a mental workout like I'll get in this class.<n><n>In response to the task above,<n>Tapanga has 8 extra candies than Corey:<n>29 + 25 + 8 = 52<n><n>Freddy spent $10.00 on calling his family on New Years Eve. 52 + 10 = 62 minutes.<n><n>Lawrence has a total of 5 days.<n><n>Michael made $97. He sold 2 at $22 and the next four were $16 and $7. Those are all the possible outcomes for buying the large, medium, and small birdhouses.<n><n>Nalani has 16 animals and they sell their puppies for $200.<n>44/4 =4 4/4 = 1<n>24/2 = 12<n>12/1 = 12 total sold<n><n>Boris and Cameron has a total of 62 puppies. 9 + 4 = 13<n><n>The jug holds 40 cups<n>It takes 40/14 = 2.86 cups to fill it to the brim. Factoring out the 4, 50/5 = 10<n><n>The task is answered using a math problem that has no variables.<n>

Rather, it moves the masts on what? Choices:  A: sailing vessel B: paddleboat C: ship D: motorboat E: tugboat<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Option (A)** The correct answer on option (A), it is not a sailing vessel. <n><n>**Option (D)** The correct answer for option (D), it is not a motorboat. <n><n>**The rest are both correct answers to answer the multiple choice questions**<n><n>### Input :A boy is running in front of a car at a rate of 3 mph.  How fast is the car going to reach him? Choices : A: 2 mph below the rate at which the boy is running B: 2 mph above the rate at which the boys are running C: at the rate with which the boys are running D: 1.5 mph faster than the rate at which the car is running E: more than 3 mph slower than the rate at which boys is running<n><n>### Response :<n>It's the correct answer that the speed of the car is greater than the speed of the boy running. So if the boy is running at 3 mph, the answer will be greater than 3 mph, for example, more than 5.5 mph because 5.5 > 3. The rest of the answers are not the correct answer.<n><n>### Input  :An airplane pilot has a bag of candy. The bag only has 31 pieces in it. She gives her first seat mate a quarter of the bag. Her second seat mate gets a quarter of the bag, as well. She gives her third and final seat mate a quarter of whatever is left over. How much of the bag does the first two passengers receive?<n><n>### Response  :<n>The first and second seats got half of the candy.<n><n>### Tip  :<n>The first question and the fourth question are missing an equal to symbol.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:John hated mosquitoes.  It wasn't the bloodsucking that he disliked, it was that the insects made what? Choices:  A: fly B: buzz C: move D: honey E: help flowers pollenate<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n><n><n>### Demonsration<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Question<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Input :<n><n>### Demesration<n><n>## Input 2 :<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>## Answer<n><n><n>## Input 3:<n><n>## Demonstraion(I will put an example on this page before posting it)<n><n>## Answer<n>

Choices:  A: misery B: sadness C: bad time D: sorrow E: play time<n><n>### Response:		<n>Incorrect.<n>Ex: Joy is used to refer to happiness, a feeling of great pleasure or contentment.<n><n>### Input:"She was so busy that she only had 10 seconds to think in her entire day. By the end of the day she was exhausted." The last sentence is referring to what? Choices:<n><n>### Response:" She was so busy that she could not think properly.  She was exhausted."<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately states a relationship or difference between the two objects.<n><n>### Examples"The fence is longer than the building." "Less water was used in the first half of the day than in the second half."<n><n>### Explanation:Two similar sentences which are related to the same topic.<n><n>### Task Response:<n>A: The fence is shorter than the building <n><n>### Instractions:<n>Write a multi-sentence argument that uses the structure and formatting requirements described below.<n><n>### Arguments:<n>There are different ways of solving problems and tasks.<n><n>### Sample Arguments:<n>The student has learned how to solve problems and is ready to go to school.<n>I want to buy a new computer because my old one is damaged. I have seen a computer in the shop and can not decide which one to buy.<n>The most important thing is to find the problem and analyze it.<n><n>### Structure:<n><n>### Sentence Starter:<n>Let us begin with analyzing the problems then make our decision on each choice.<n>Let us first define a few criteria that we will use in the evaluation.<n>In the first step we need to determine the problem we are solving for then we can continue evaluating the different choices we have.<n><n>### Filling in the Blanks:<n>_____ is the first step to find the problem we are solving. <n>Once we have determined that we will have to define criteria that will help us in our evaluation _____.<n><n>### Response Task:<n>You must write a response that appropriately responds to the prompt. <n><n>### Sample Response:"Now, to put all of the pieces together that I discussed above is the second step, or the evaluation. I will be looking at the criteria that are going to help me in answering which choice is the best one and how does this choice help

If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n><n>### Response:		Glass<n>We can use the concept of least common multiple to do this problem.  We will do some test cases on paper first.<n><n>### Input:[1,9].<n><n>### Response:[6]<n><n>Notice that we can get different answers by including/omitting.<n>```<n>[2,8,6]<n>[6,2]<n>```<n><n>### Input:@[2,9].<n><n>The output should be the same as previous problem.<n><n>### Include/Exclude Test<n>Now we'll create code to do this test.<n>```clojure<n>(do-not-call [f] [l] [r])<n>```<n>### Implementation<n>```clojure<n>(defn do-not-call [l r]<n>    (if (= (dec r) (inc l)) r<n>      l))<n><n>(do-not/includes? [1 3] [2 4])<n>```<n>## Solution<n>```clojure<n>(include/excludes? [10] [5 1])<n><n>(...2 10)<n>```<n>### The idea is that the input has to change in order to exclude/include specific numbers<n>

Use what you know about programming, and then also what you know about coding,<n><n>### Dutrood, a member of the Dwarven community, has two armor sets. How many pieces of armor sets can be taken as a pair?<n><n>### Recipe<n><n>Answer: 8 (15 -15 -15) = 8 (15-3) = 8 x 12.<n><n>### Kane, a member of the Zoroastrian community, has 3 piles of rice and 3 piles of peppers. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. The word “what” is a relative pronoun; It can be used as noun, interrogative pronoun, adjective, or adverb.<n><n>Input: You are seeking to provide yourself with what when you're a student? Choices: A: a work B: an employment C: an income D: a hope E: an offer<n><n>Input: I made pancakes for dinner yesterday. Choices: A: I went for a walk B: It is time to clean C: It will rain D: I watched a movie E: I got a gift<n><n>Answer: It should say "I made pancakes for my dinner yesterday"<n><n>Answer: I would use the interrogative pronoun "what."<n><n>Answer: "What" is an ambiguous pronoun, which is why the word must indicate its use (i.e., "what did you do?").<n><n>Answer: What's a good word? How about "job" for choices A and B.<n><n>Answer: For this question, I believe that you need to use some imaginative words that can fulfill the request.<n><n>Input: I am seeking to provide myself with "job" when I'm applying for a job.<n><n>### Answer:What is the relationship between the instruction text and its response?<n><n>Answer: The instruction states that the learner has to answer the instruction. How many grams of toy does Sawyer have?<n><n>Answer: 7,128<n><n>### Instructino-Demonstration<n>Input: Michael lives 5 miles from school. He rides his bike there.  He rides his bi to school 4 days per week, and walks to school the other 4 days. When he rides, he takes the route shown in the diagram below. He rides 6 miles the first day, traveling the route in 0.74 minutes (1440 feet per mile / 720 feet per minute). Each day after that, he travels 3 miles more, but it takes him 10% longer. On what day does he travel 3 miles and then walk 1 mile?<n><n>Answer: Day 20.<n><n>He rides 6 miles on Day 1, followed by 2 days of riding 3 miles: that totals 9 miles.  Now, it takes him 1.04 minutes to ride the 9-mile path, rather than the 0.74.  So on Day 20, he rides 3 miles, then walks 1, bringing the total distance to 4 miles.  On Day 20, it will take him 1.09 or 1.1 minutes to ride that 4-mile path.  Then on Day 21, he rides 2 miles and walks 1, for a total of 3 miles.  Now the 4-mile path takes him 1.12 or 1.

A) if it turned off before the toast was fully cooked, it would not function adequately.  B) if it turned off after the toast was fully prepared, it would not be functional.  C) if it only popped up the toast and it would not be functional because the toast would continue to cook.  D) if it pops up the toast and continues to cook, it is functional because the toast is continuously being cooked.  E) I don't know<n><n>### Expert Response:It is a toaster. <n>### Reason for answer: <n><n>##Expert's Reason for Answer:<n><n>### Coders' Response:<n>### The reason for selecting the incorrect option was that your coding team thought that "E": I don't know should also have been an option.<n>For each code of the task, you may specify a reason that explains the difference between the selected and the nonselected answer options. The selected answer option should be the one that best explains or supports the reason. Avoid reasons or codes for which you are not sure as that impacts the assessment. Please note the following: the system does not require you to select more than one reason per line per code; each line may be a different reason for a different selection per code in a task.<n><n>### Coder's Reason:<n><n>## Explanation:<n><n>## Expert's Response for Answering Questions with Expert Input<n><n>## Reason for answer:<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>## # of questions per task: <n>The total number of questions in a task is the sum of the numbers of questions in Part I, Part II, and Part III.

Choose only one answer.​ Answer:D**<n><n><n>## # A18985766<n><n>* ## Instruction:Write a program, using Ruby, that finds the best combination of food for your pets. Below is an instruction that provides the necessary information to complete this task.<n><n>  ### Instruction:Write a script that does the following:<n><n>  * Reads an inventory file with items and quantities at the start of the day.<n><n>  * Calculates a balance of how many item quantities remain at the end of the day.<n>  * If no items remain, prints the string No Items Exist!!.<n><n>  * If there are items left, the script prompts the user to choose one item to consume. The script then prints the current balance.<n><n>  * The script repeats the process until the inventory is consumed.<n><n>  * Store inventories in a file named ingredients.txt with each item name on a separate line. Store item quantities as whole numbers without decimal places in the format followed by the space character. The value must be greater than 0.<n><n>  * A total of 40 units of each item must be stored. It is fine if the remaining units are not equal. An item may be chosen more than once. It does not matter if an item was consumed previously.<n><n>  * Do not enter any other information.<n><n>### Input1:<n>Ingredients.txt<n><n>[Milk, 1 ]<n>     [Pasta, 20 ]<n>     [Grains, 13 ]<n>     [Spinach, 23 ]<n>     [Green beans, 1 ]<n>[Bananas, 3 ]<n>     [Honeydew, 8]<n>     [Watermelon, 6]<n>     [Strawberries, 8]<n><n>### Output<n>1. Choose one item to consume.<n><n>  Choose one item to lose: strawberries (2)<n>  No Items Exist!!<n>  You Lose 3!!<n>  You Loss 3!!<n><n>### Input2:

After she adds water from the sink, she has 15 more than the amount she started with. At the same time, Brian has three water bottles. After he fills them with water from the tap, he has 6 more than the amount he started with. What was the total amount of water in both Alice's and Brian's water bottles?<n><n>### Challenge Solution:The final amount equals:<n><n>```<n>15 + 6 = 21<n><n>-6<n>```

He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:If you're known to buy presents for others often you would be called what? Choices:  A: appear suddenly B: bottom out C: go downtown D: scream E: roll over<n><n>### Response:		**A:**<n><n>### Instructions:In each question, read the statement and list or write every reason it might be true.<n><n>- One of these two statements is true.<n><n>- Each of these statements is true.<n>- None of these statements is true<n><n>- Only one of these statements is true or only two of these statements are true<n>- - At least three of these statements is true, or<n>at most two of these statements is true  <n>  <n>### Demonstaion:<n>Input: I was shopping at a Car Dealership, and what did a salesman did that the customer was happy with you?<n><n>Exampel: A<n>- The salesman went over the paperwork<n>- The service was excellent<n>- The person was knowledgeable about the cars<n>- He did not intimidate<n>- He didn't bothered me<n>- They worked around my schedule<n><n>### Response to the question below:<n>### Input: If it rained, he'll need boots<n>- The rainy season will last a long time<n>- His feet may become ill<n>- The rain may cause flooding<n>- His feet might get wet and develop fungus<n>- The ground may become wet and unsafe<n>### Response:<n>- The rain may ruin his shoes<n>- He might not have an extra set of boots<n>- He may be unable to ride his bike<n>- He might experience health problems<n>- He may be in danger on his bike<n><n>### Response below:<n><n>### Input.<n>- If I had less money, I wouldn't want an expensive car.<n>- I'm in financial trouble.<n>- In the future, I'll have even more debts.<n>- My debts are increasing.<n>- I don't know how to control my money.<n>- People can afford to live very well.<n>- I'll always pay my minimum payments.<n><n>- People buy expensive things all the time.<n><n>### Response<n>- I'm not in a better position to have an expensive car.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: problems B: crying C: inspiration D: trauma E: nightmares<n><n>### Response:		<n>**A: problems**<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input 43:<n>An old man once had a beautiful garden. In the springtime it was filled with lovely red and yellow lilies. In the summer, the blue roses and pink hyacinths filled the garden with their sweet scents and beautiful blooms. In the autumn, the flowers were replaced by bright orange, yellow, red, and green chrysanthemums. But when winter came, the beautiful flowers were gone and only the old man's ragged beard and dirty face remained.<n><n>In the next morning, the old man looked out at the garden, all its flowers gone. The old man was very discouraged and decided to sell the empty garden. He went to the city and asked Mr. Jackson to buy the garden. Mr. Jackson said, ``I will give you $500 cash, but you can't tell me why.'' The old man sold the garden.<n><n>The next day, Mr Jackson asked the old man to come to his house. Mr Jackson called the old man in. He looked at the old man. He was dirty, grumpy, and unkempt. Mr Jackson handed him an envelope.<n><n>The old man opened the envelope, only to find $500 written on the inside. He was so mad. ``What's this?'' he exclaimed. Mr Jackson shrugged. ``You sold your garden to me, and that's why I bought it.''<n><n>### Instructed to answer:<n>Why do you think the old man was in such bad shape? How was the old man supposed to be treated? How would you treat the old man?<n><n><n><n>### Output<n><n>### Demosntration:<n>What do you think the old woman had that she needed to borrow? How did the man react to her questions?<n><n>### Insturctions:<n><n>## Demostration<n><n>### Instution:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>## Instructions:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. How much money, in dollars, did he make this week?<n>Answer: 97<n><n>Input: Nalani had two female dogs that were expecting and after a month gave birth to 10 puppies each. She then sold 3/4 of the puppies after they came of age, each at $200. Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature. Choices:  A: humidifier B: surface of earth C: skating rink D: ice cube E: burn it to the ground<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A:  surface of earth<n>B: A and B<n>C: D and E<n>D: A<n>E: C<n><n>Explanation:<n><n>**A: surface of earth** - The Earth's atmosphere can be composed primarily of nitrogen and oxygen. The water vapor in the atmosphere can cause a house to feel humid, even if the air is dry. Dry air can be caused by low humidity. 40% relative humidity is considered mildly humid.<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>In this task, you will have several instructions. It is also a place in which people can withdraw money. <n><n>### Input :If you eat candy and do extra credit, how many pieces of candy do you get to eat?<n><n>### Response :If you eat caterpillars and do extra credit, you get to eat less candy (1 - 1/2 piece) and you would have to do more extra credit (1 - 1 1/4 credit). Total you should have to eat, 2 pieces of candy and earning 1 1/2 extra credits.<n><n>### Input<n>It cost 9 dollars to make a book and the printer made a profit of 96%. How much money did they make per book?<n><n>### Respond<n> It cost 9 dollars to makr 1 book and the printer made the profit of 96% and the total that the printer made was 9.6 dollars and we made 9.6 divided by 9 which is.66 dollars.<n><n>### Respons<n>If a book costs 5 dollars to make and the price is twice the  cost, what is its price?<n><n>### resp<n> It cost 9 dollar to make a book and then u double it to make it 18 and then multiply it by 2 which is 36 divided 36 by 2 is 18.95 dollars that is what it costs the 18 dollars  and 95 cents.<n><n>###Input<n>An animal eats 7 pounds of meat each week and the price is 2.5 times as many as the week before. How much does it cost if it cost 3.75?<n><n>###Respond<n>It cost 3.76 that is the new price divided by 2 and took the quotient and multiply by 3.75<n><n>###Input: You should wash at least one weekend or three days in succession. Choices:  A: tighten B: packaged C: bound D: faithful E: compact<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>1. To bind loose papers together, use a spiral binding.<n>2. To make a ring binder, fold a piece of paper into three or eight.<n>3. To hold papers together, staple them or tape them securely.<n>4. To protect papers, use a three-ring or plastic loose-leaf binder.<n>5. To tighten papers, roll them up tightly and then roll the paper with tape that adheres to each other.

Calculate the total amount of money she received from the sale of the puppies.<n>Answer: 3000<n><n>Input: Boris has 24 books and he donates a fourth of his books to the library. Cameron has 30 books and he donates a third of his books to the library. After donating their books, how many books in total do Boris and Cameron have together?<n>Answer: 38<n><n>Input: There are 3 boxes of cereal. One box holds 14 ounces of cereal. Another box holds half the amount of the first box and 5 ounces less than the third box. How much cereal is there in all 3 cereal boxes?<n>Answer: 33<n><n>Input: A jug needs 40 cups of water to be full. A custodian at Truman Elementary School has to fill water jugs for 200 students, who drink 10 cups of water in a day. How many water jugs will the custodian fill with cups of water to provide the students with all the water they need in a day?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: It takes 1 hour for refrigerated dough to come to room temperature.  It takes 15 minutes to shape the dough and 2 hours to proof.  The bread takes 30 minutes to bake and 15 minutes to cool.  If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:The print was extremely small, as he was reading letter after letter he began to suffer eye what? Choices:  A: strain B: though C: happiness D: realization E: understanding<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice Question. Each question is worth one point.<n><n>### Input<n>What is the value of 7 + 7 - 4 - 5?<n><n>Answers: 4 <n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>Input: Michael makes birdhouses to sell at craft shows. He charges $22 for each large birdhouse, $16 for each medium birdhouse, and $7 for each small birdhouse. This week, he sold 2 large birdhouses, 2 medium birdhouses, and 3 small birdhouses. If the bakery opens at 6:00 am, what is the latest time the head baker can make it to the store to start working?<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:If I have a reception with many people attending, where should I be sure to hold it? Choices:  A: grand casino B: large room C: restaurant D: country club E: lobby<n><n>### Response:		I would say there are two reasons to get it done sooner rather than later. One is that the larger the gathering, the longer you have to plan. Planning a large gathering takes forethought and consideration. Planning a smaller event is less cumbersome. The other reason that I would start sooner is because the larger the gathering or event, the more important it is to ensure that everything goes smoothly. An event in a small room is much easier to repair than a large event. Having a large event also increases the chance that something will go completely wrong.<n><n>### Input:-324<n><n>### Response:-240<n><n>### Input-256<n><n>### Response-244<n><n>### Input:$285<n><n>### Response:$364<n><n>### InstructionsWrite a statement of "In your own words..." in place of each bolded prompt.<n><n>### Screenshot<n>![](../../.gitbook/assets/task4.png)<n><n>### Response<n>

Choices: A: his alarm clock B: himself in the mirror C: shadows on the bedroom wall D: the window E: the cat<n><n>### Response :What does he see?,B :What else does he see?,B: His clock is right next to his bed, and it has been 2 hours since he started snoozing. The clock has not only woken Bill, but it has also made him aware of the fact that he has not slept enough.  <n><n>## Question 1:<n><n>What does Freddy's dad have more of than Freddy's brother?.<n>Ans : more minutes,15 minutes<n><n>## Question 2:<n><n>Michael charges $22 for a large birdhouse, $3 for a medium birdhouse, and 80 cents for a small birdhouse, how much money, in dollars does he make from all birdhouses together?<n>Ans : $1900.<n><n><n>## Question 3 :<n><n>There are 4 puppies.
